      38             : #if NEAR_AND_FAR_ALLOWED
      39             : 
      40             : static void scan_near_or_far(a_type_qualifier_set  *qualifiers)
      41             : /*
      42             : Scan a "near" or "far" memory attribute, setting a bit in *qualifiers if
      43             : there is no error.
      44             : */
      45             : {
      46             :   a_type_qualifier_set new_qualifier;
      47             : 
      48             :   if (curr_token == tok_near) {
      49             :     new_qualifier = TQ_NEAR;
      50             :   } else {
      51             :     check_assertion(curr_token == tok_far);
      52             :     new_qualifier = TQ_FAR;
      53             :   }  /* if */
      54             :   /* Check for incompatibilities. */
      55             :   if (*qualifiers & new_qualifier) {
      56             :     /* The bit is already set -- this is a duplicate. */
      57             :     pos_warning(ec_dupl_mem_attrib, &error_position);
      58             :   } else if ((*qualifiers & (TQ_NEAR | TQ_FAR)) != TQ_NONE) {
      59             :     /* The other bit has already been set -- error. */
      60             :     pos_error(ec_mem_attrib_incompatible, &error_position);
      61             :     new_qualifier = TQ_NONE;
      62             :   }  /* if */
      63             :   *qualifiers |= new_qualifier;
      64             :   (void)get_token();        
      65             : }  /* scan_near_or_far */
      66             : 
      67             : #endif /* NEAR_AND_FAR_ALLOWED */
      68             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
      69             : 
      70             : a_boolean convert_GUID_string_literal(a_constant_ptr  strcon,
      71             :                                       char            **pstr)
      72             : /*
      73             : strcon represents a string literal.  Return TRUE if its contents are of the
      74             : form
      75             :  hhhhhhhh-hhhh-hhhh-hhhh-hhhhhhhhhhhh
      76             : (where "h" is any hex digit and the hyphens are required), optionally enclosed
      77             : in braces.  If TRUE is returned, set *pstr to point to a null-terminated,
      78             : normalized (i.e., lower case) copy of the sequence of digits and hyphens;
      79             : otherwise, set *pstr to NULL.
      80             : */
      81             : {
      82             :   a_boolean      result = TRUE;
      83             :   a_const_char   *str = strcon->variant.string.value;
      84             :   a_targ_size_t  length;
      85             : 
      86             :   *pstr = NULL;
      87             :   /* Get the string length not including the trailing null character. */
      88             :   check_assertion(strcon->variant.string.length > 0);
      89             :   length = strcon->variant.string.length-1;
      90             :   /* A valid GUID string is 36 or 38 characters (depending on the presence of
      91             :      braces).  Check this first to avoid bound error with pointer and length
      92             :      adjustments below. */
      93             :   if (length < 36) {
      94             :     result = FALSE;
      95             :     goto done;
      96             :   }  /* if */
      97             :   /* Check and adjust for surrounding braces. */
      98             :   if (*str == '{') {
      99             :     /* Check for matching closing brace. */
     100             :     if (str[length-1] != '}') {
     101             :       result = FALSE;
     102             :       goto done;
     103             :     }  /* if */
     104             :     str++;
     105             :     length -= 2;
     106             :   }  /* if */
     107             :   /* Check the digits and hyphens. */
     108             :   if (!is_valid_GUID_string(str, length)) {
     109             :     result = FALSE;
     110             :   } else {
     111             :     /* Copy the string, lower-casing hex letters so that strcmp can be used to
     112             :        compare strings. */
     113             :     a_const_char *src = str;
     114             :     char         *dst = alloc_primary_file_scope_il((sizeof_t)length+1);
     115             :     int          count = (int)length;
     116             :     *pstr = dst;
     117             :     for (; count != 0; count--) {
     118             :       char ch = *src++;
     119             :       if (isalpha((unsigned char)ch)) ch = tolower((int)ch);
     120             :       *dst++ = ch;
     121             :     }  /* for */
     122             :     *dst = '\0';
     123             :   }  /* if */
     124             : done:
     125             :   return result;
     126             : }  /* convert_GUID_string_literal */
     127             : 
     128             : 
     129             : char *scan_GUID_string(void)
     130             : /*
     131             : Scan the string literal token or unquoted UUID token that contains a GUID
     132             : string.  Extract and check the format of the string.  Return a pointer to
     133             : a primary IL string containing the GUID characters.  If the string is not
     134             : of the required form, a diagnostic is issued and a NULL pointer is returned.
     135             : For an unquoted UUID token, const_for_curr_token contains a string constant
     136             : that is equivalent to the one that would have been created if it were
     137             : quoted.
     138             : 
     139             : The string optionally begins and ends with braces and is of the form
     140             :   hhhhhhhh-hhhh-hhhh-hhhh-hhhhhhhhhhhh
     141             : where "h" is any hex digit and the hyphens are required.
     142             : 
     143             : Any alphabetic characters in the string are converted to lower case in the
     144             : string that is returned.
     145             : */
     146             : {
     147             :   char  *result = NULL;
     148             : 
     149             :   if (curr_token != tok_string_literal && curr_token != tok_uuid) {
     150             :     /* Error. */
     151             :     syntax_error(ec_bad_uuid_string);
     152             :   } else if (is_error_constant(&const_for_curr_token)) {
     153             :     /* We encountered a misformed string literal.  An error should
     154             :        have been issued already. */
     155             :     check_assertion(total_errors != 0);
     156             :   } else {
     157             :     if (!convert_GUID_string_literal(&const_for_curr_token, &result)) {
     158             :       pos_error(ec_bad_uuid_string, &error_position);
     159             :     }  /* if */
     160             :     /* Bypass the string literal token. */
     161             :     (void)get_token();
     162             :   }  /* if */
     163             :   return result;
     164             : }  /* scan_GUID_string */
     165             : 
     166             : 
     167             : static a_boolean scan_inheritance_kind(an_inheritance_kind  *inheritance_kind,
     168             :                                        a_source_position    *pos)
     169             : /*
     170             : Unless *inheritance_kind is already set, scan for an inheritance kind keyword
     171             : -- i.e.,
     172             :   __single_inheritance
     173             :   __multiple_inheritance
     174             :   __virtual_inheritance
     175             : (each of which can also be spelled with a single leading underscore) -- and
     176             : return the result in *inheritance_kind.  The source position of the specified
     177             : inheritance kind is returned in *pos.  Return TRUE if the scan is successful.
     178             : */
     179             : {
     180             :   a_boolean    found = FALSE;
     181             :   a_const_char *name;
     182             : 
     183             :   if (*inheritance_kind == (an_inheritance_kind)ihk_none) {
     184             :     check_assertion(curr_token == tok_identifier);
     185             :     name = locator_for_curr_id.symbol_header->identifier;
     186             :     if (*(name++) == '_') {
     187             :       if (*name == '_') name++;
     188             :       /* Check the name without its leading single or double underscore. */
     189             :       if (strcmp(name, "single_inheritance") == 0) {
     190             :         *inheritance_kind = (an_inheritance_kind)ihk_single;
     191             :         found = TRUE;
     192             :       } else if (strcmp(name, "multiple_inheritance") == 0) {
     193             :         *inheritance_kind = (an_inheritance_kind)ihk_multiple;
     194             :         found = TRUE;
     195             :       } else if (strcmp(name, "virtual_inheritance") == 0) {
     196             :         *inheritance_kind = (an_inheritance_kind)ihk_virtual;
     197             :         found = TRUE;
     198             :       }  /* if */
     199             :       if (found) {
     200             :         /* Remember the source position, in case a diagnostic is required
     201             :            later. */
     202             :         *pos = pos_curr_token;
     203             :         /* Advance past the inheritance-kind keyword. */
     204             :         (void)get_token();
     205             :       }  /* if */
     206             :     }  /* if */
     207             :   }  /* if */
     208             :   return found;
     209             : }  /* scan_inheritance_kind */
     210             : 
     211             : 
     212             : static a_boolean any_multiple_inheritance(a_type_ptr  class_type)
     213             : /*
     214             : Return TRUE if the specified class type or any of its base classes was
     215             : declared with more than one base class.
     216             : */
     217             : {
     218             :   a_boolean                    multiple = FALSE;

     227             :          class.  Otherwise, it depends on the inheritance of the
     228             :          associated class type. */
     229             :       multiple = TRUE;
     230             :     }  /* if */
     231             :   }  /* if */
     232             :   return multiple;
     233             : }  /* any_multiple_inheritance */

     239             : /*

     263             : 
     264             : static void apply_microsoft_w64_specifier(a_type_ptr         *type_ptr,
     265             :                                           a_source_position  *err_pos)
     266             : /*
     267             : Replace the given type with a copy that is marked as having been specified
     268             : with the __w64 token.  Except for signedness and qualifiers the given type
     269             : must be int, long, or a pointer type; if not, an error is issued at the
     270             : given position.

     273             :   a_type_ptr       plain_type = skip_typerefs(*type_ptr);

     301             : void add_flags_from_dll_attributes(a_decl_modifier   *p_flags,
     302             :                                    an_attribute_ptr  ap)
     303             : /*
     304             : Set the DM_DLLIMPORT or DM_DLLEXPORT flag if the corresponding attribute is
     305             : present in the list pointed to by ap, except if doing so would cause both
     306             : flags to be set (in that case, issue a warning).
     307             : */
     308             : {
     309             :   for (; ap != NULL; ap = ap->next) {
     310             :     if (ap->kind == (a_byte_attribute_kind)ak_dllimport) {
     311             :       if (*p_flags & DM_DLLEXPORT) {

     325             : 
     326             : 
     327             : void update_dll_info_for_class(a_type_ptr         class_type,
     328             :                                a_decl_modifier    flags,
     329             :                                a_boolean          explicit_inst,
     330             :                                a_boolean          adjust_template_base,
     331             :                                a_source_position  *err_pos)
     332             : /*
     333             : Update the given class type to reflect any dllimport/dllexport flags recorded
     334             : in flags.  If explicit_inst is TRUE, this routine is called for the explicit
     335             : instantiation of class_type.  If adjust_template_base is TRUE, class type is a
     336             : base class of a class being defined with a DLL interface: If class_type is a
     337             : template class, its DLL interface may need to be adjusted implicitly.
     338             : */
     339             : {
     340             :   a_decl_modifier  new_dll_flags = (flags & DM_DLLFLAGS);
     341             : 
     342             :   /* dllimport and dllexport should never be set together. */
     343             :   check_assertion(new_dll_flags != DM_DLLFLAGS);
     344             :   if (new_dll_flags != 0) {
     345             :     a_class_type_supplement_ptr  ctsp = class_type_supp(class_type);
     346             :     if (!adjust_template_base &&
     347             :         class_type->source_corresp.name_linkage !=
     348             :                                           (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_external &&
     349             :         is_member_of_unnamed_namespace(&class_type->source_corresp)) {
     350             :       /* dllimport/dllexport on an unnamed namespace member is unlikely to
     351             :          be useful. */
     352             :       pos_warning(ec_dll_interface_in_unnamed_namespace, err_pos);
     353             :     }  /* if */
     354             :     if (!class_type_has_body(class_type)) {
     355             :       /* Apply the new flag values to the class type only. */
     356             :       ctsp->decl_modifiers &= ~DM_DLLFLAGS;
     357             :       ctsp->decl_modifiers |= new_dll_flags;
     358             :     } else if (explicit_inst || adjust_template_base) {
     359             :       /* Either an explicit instantiation or a template class used as a base
     360             :          class of a derived class with a DLL interface: Update the flags on
     361             :          the members if needed. */
     362             :       a_decl_modifier  old_dll_flags = (ctsp->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLFLAGS);
     363             :       if (adjust_template_base &&
     364             :           (!class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_template_class ||
     365             :            class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_specialized)) {
     366             :         /* The DLL interface of a base class type is only adjusted for base
     367             :            class types that are implicit template specializations.  Otherwise,
     368             :            we warn about inconsistent DLL interfaces in base class type. */
     369             :         if ((ctsp->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLFLAGS) != new_dll_flags) {
     370             :           pos_warning(ec_base_class_has_different_dll_interface, err_pos);
     371             :         }  /* if */
     372             :       } else if (old_dll_flags != 0) {
     373             :         /* The class template instantiation already has a DLL interface: Do
     374             :            not change it. */
     375             :         if (explicit_inst && (old_dll_flags | new_dll_flags) == DM_DLLFLAGS) {
     376             :           /* A previous specialization had the opposite DLL interface, which
     377             :              is an error for explicit instantiations. */
     378             :           pos_error(ec_bad_combination_of_dll_attributes, err_pos);
     379             :         }  /* if */
     380             :       } else {
     381             :         /* Traverse member functions and static data members and apply the
     382             :            DLL interface to those too.  Members of nested classes and in-class
     383             :            friend definitions are not affected.  Then recursively update any
     384             :            base class if appropriate. */
     385             :         a_routine_ptr     rp = ctsp->assoc_scope->routines;
     386             :         a_variable_ptr    vp = ctsp->assoc_scope->variables;
     387             :         a_base_class_ptr  bcp = ctsp->base_classes;
     388             : #if DO_IL_LOWERING
     389             :         a_boolean         specialized_dtor_or_ctor = FALSE;
     390             : #endif /* DO_IL_LOWERING */
     391             :         /* First update the DLL interface of the class itself. */
     392             :         ctsp->decl_modifiers |= new_dll_flags;
     393             :         if (new_dll_flags & DM_DLLIMPORT) {
     394             :           /* Members of a dllimport class are not instantiated. */
     395             :           update_instantiation_flags_for_class(
     396             :              symbol_for(class_type), (a_pragma_kind)pk_do_not_instantiate,
     397             :              err_pos, /*is_pragma=*/FALSE, /*top_level=*/TRUE,
     398             :              /*is_dll_directive=*/TRUE);
     399             :         }  /* if */
     400             :         for (; rp != NULL; rp = rp->next) {
     401             :           if (!rp->is_specialized && !rp->is_prototype_instantiation) {
     402             :             if ((rp->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLFLAGS) != 0) {
     403             :               /* This can only happen in situations like the following:
     404             :                    template<class T> struct B {
     405             :                       __declspec(dllexport) void f();
     406             :                    };
     407             :                    struct __declspec(dllexport) D: B<int> ();
     408             :                  Microsoft compilers raise an error on such constructs and
     409             :                  we follow suit. */
     410             :               check_assertion(adjust_template_base);
     411             :               pos_sy_error(
     412             :                     ec_class_and_inherited_member_instance_have_dll_interface,
     413             :                     err_pos, symbol_for(rp));
     414             :             } else {
     415             :               update_dll_info_for_routine(
     416             :                         rp, new_dll_flags, (a_boolean)rp->is_inline,
     417             :                         /*is_redecl=*/FALSE, /*is_definition=*/FALSE, err_pos);
     418             :             }  /* if */
     419             : #if DO_IL_LOWERING
     420             :           } else if (rp->special_kind ==
     421             :                                     (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor ||
     422             :                      rp->special_kind ==
     423             :                                     (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor) {
     424             :             specialized_dtor_or_ctor = TRUE;
     425             : #endif /* DO_IL_LOWERING */
     426             :           }  /* if */
     427             :         }  /* for */
     428             :         if (new_dll_flags & DM_DLLIMPORT) {
     429             :           /* Microsoft compilers do not propagate the dllimport flag to
     430             :              static data members of template instances. */
     431             :         } else {
     432             :           for (; vp != NULL; vp = vp->next) {
     433             :             if (!vp->is_specialized && !vp->is_prototype_instantiation) {
     434             :               if ((vp->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLFLAGS) != 0) {
     435             :                 /* This can only happen in situations like the following:
     436             :                      template<class T> struct B {
     437             :                         __declspec(dllexport) static int s;
     438             :                      };
     439             :                      struct __declspec(dllexport) D: B<int> ();
     440             :                    Microsoft compilers raise an error on such constructs and
     441             :                    we follow suit. */
     442             :                 check_assertion(adjust_template_base);
     443             :                 pos_sy_error(
     444             :                     ec_class_and_inherited_member_instance_have_dll_interface,
     445             :                     err_pos, symbol_for(vp));
     446             :               } else {
     447             :                 update_dll_info_for_variable(
     448             :                                        vp, new_dll_flags, /*is_redecl=*/FALSE,
     449             :                                        /*is_definition=*/FALSE, err_pos);
     450             :               }  /* if */
     451             :             }  /* if */
     452             :           }  /* for */
     453             :         }  /* if */
     454             : #if DO_IL_LOWERING
     455             :         if ((new_dll_flags & DM_DLLIMPORT) && !specialized_dtor_or_ctor) {
     456             :           /* Microsoft compilers do not propagate the dllimport flag to
     457             :              compiler-generated data (like virtual function tables)
     458             :              associated with class template instances, except (apparently)
     459             :              when such an instance contains an explicitly specialized
     460             :              destructor or constructor. */
     461             :         } else {
     462             :           if (class_type->typeinfo_var != NULL) {
     463             :             update_dll_info_for_variable(class_type->typeinfo_var,
     464             :                                          new_dll_flags, /*is_redecl=*/FALSE,
     465             :                                          /*is_definition=*/FALSE,
     466             :                                          (a_source_position*)NULL);
     467             :           }  /* if */
     468             :           if (ctsp->virtual_function_table_var != NULL) {
     469             :             update_dll_info_for_variable(ctsp->virtual_function_table_var,
     470             :                                          new_dll_flags, /*is_redecl=*/FALSE,
     471             :                                          /*is_definition=*/FALSE,
     472             :                                          (a_source_position*)NULL);
     473             :           }  /* if */
     474             : #if IA64_ABI
     475             :           if (ctsp->virtual_table_table_var != NULL) {
     476             :             update_dll_info_for_variable(ctsp->virtual_table_table_var,

     484             :         for (; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
     485             :           if (bcp->direct) {
     486             :             a_type_ptr       base_type = skip_typerefs(bcp->type);

     820             : 
     821         227 : void check_for_class_modifiers(a_token_kind  *next_tok,
     822             :                                a_token_kind  body_start,
     823             :                                a_boolean     tag_name_first)
     824             : /*
     825             : C++11 permits
     826             :     struct F final: B { ... };
     827             : and Microsoft compilers accept constructs like:
     828             :     struct S sealed abstract: B { ... };
     829             : where "final", "sealed", and "abstract" are context-sensitive keywords: They
     830             : are scanned as identifiers, but must be treated like keywords in certain
     831             : contexts.  Unfortunately, that means we may need to look ahead several tokens
     832             : to determine whether or not a definition follows.  (In particular,
     833             :     struct S sealed;
     834             : should be treated as a declaration of a variable named "sealed", and not a
     835             : declaration of a sealed type "S".)
     836             : If tag_name_first is TRUE, this routine assumes that the token stream contains
     837             : a generalized identifier followed by one or more plain identifiers.  If
     838             : tag_name_first is FALSE, this routine assumes that the token stream contains
     839             : one or more plain identifiers.  If these plain identifiers turn out to be
     840             : context-sensitive keywords, the tokens are transformed accordingly (i.e., they
     841             : become "tok_abstract" or "tok_sealed" keywords).  *next_tok is set to the token
     842             : kind that follows the tag name and the class modifiers (if any).  body_start is
     843             : the token that represents the beginning of a class body: tok_lbrace in the
     844             : normal case, and tok_end_of_source during template prescanning.
     845             : */
     846             : {
     847         227 :   a_token_cache  orig_token_cache;
     848         227 :   a_token_cache  transformed_token_cache;
     849         227 :   a_token_kind   tok;
     850         227 :   a_token_kind   orig_next_tok;
     851         227 :   a_boolean      valid = FALSE;
     852         227 :   a_boolean      transformed_cache_used = FALSE;
     853         227 :   a_boolean      identifier_cached = FALSE;
     854             : 
     855         227 :   check_assertion(curr_token == tok_identifier);
     856         227 :   clear_token_cache(&orig_token_cache, /*reusable=*/TRUE);
     857             :   /* Cache the first identifier. */
     858         227 :   cache_curr_token(&orig_token_cache);
     859         227 :   if (!tag_name_first) {
     860           0 :     identifier_cached = TRUE;
     861             :   }  /* if */
     862         227 :   tok = orig_next_tok = get_token();
     863             :   /* Cache additional identifiers (if any). */
     864         344 :   while (tok == tok_identifier) {
     865         117 :     identifier_cached = TRUE;
     866         117 :     cache_curr_token(&orig_token_cache);
     867         117 :     tok = get_token();
     868             :   }  /* while */
     869         227 :   terminate_token_cache(&orig_token_cache);
     870         227 :   if (identifier_cached &&
     871         117 :       (tok == body_start || tok == tok_colon ||
     872             :        tok == tok_removed_template_body)) {
     873             :     /* A class definition: The cached identifiers should have been
     874             :        context-sensitive keywords.  Make an additional pass over the
     875             :        cached tokens, turning the identifiers into keywords when
     876             :        possible.  Construct a new cache containing the new tokens. */
     877           0 :     rescan_reusable_cache(&orig_token_cache);
     878           0 :     *next_tok = tok;
     879           0 :     clear_token_cache(&transformed_token_cache, /*reusable=*/FALSE);
     880           0 :     if (tag_name_first) {
     881           0 :       cache_curr_token(&transformed_token_cache);
     882           0 :       transformed_cache_used = TRUE;
     883           0 :       (void)get_token();
     884             :     }  /* if */
     885           0 :     for (; curr_token != tok_end_of_source; (void)get_token()) {
     886           0 :       if (check_context_sensitive_keyword(tok_final, "final")) {
     887           0 :         cache_curr_token(&transformed_token_cache);
     888             :         /* If we found any context-sensitive keywords, we should use the
     889             :            transformed cache. */
     890           0 :         valid = TRUE;
     891             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
     892             :       } else if (ms_extensions &&
     893             :                  (microsoft_version >= 1400 || cli_or_cx_enabled) &&
     894             :                  (check_context_sensitive_keyword(tok_abstract, "abstract") ||
     895             :                   check_context_sensitive_keyword(tok_sealed, "sealed"))) {
     896             :         cache_curr_token(&transformed_token_cache);
     897             :         /* If we found any context-sensitive keywords, we should use the
     898             :            transformed cache. */
     899             :         valid = TRUE;
     900             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
     901             :       }  /* if */
     902             :     }  /* for */
     903           0 :     (void)get_token();
     904             :   }  /* if */
     905             :   /* If we encountered a valid sequence of class modifiers, return the token
     906             :      after the modifier list as the next token, and rescan the transformed
     907             :      list of  tokens.  Otherwise, return the original next token and continue
     908             :      scanning the original token stream. */
     909           0 :   if (valid) {
     910           0 :     *next_tok = tok;
     911           0 :     rescan_cached_tokens(&transformed_token_cache);
     912             :   } else {
     913         227 :     *next_tok = orig_next_tok;
     914         227 :     rescan_copy_of_cache(&orig_token_cache);
     915         227 :     if (transformed_cache_used) {
     916             :       /* Free any cached tokens in the transformed cache. */
     917           0 :       discard_token_cache(&transformed_token_cache);
     918             :     }  /* if */
     919             :   }  /* if */
     920         227 :   discard_token_cache(&orig_token_cache);
     921         227 : }  /* check_for_class_modifiers */
     922             : 
     923             : 
     924       30607 : static a_boolean tag_definition_next(a_token_kind   next_tok,
     925             :                                      a_symbol_kind  tag_kind,
     926             :                                      a_boolean      is_ref_within_new_expr,
     927             :                                      a_boolean      no_definition_allowed)
     928             : /*
     929             : We've seen the beginning of a class, struct, union, or enum declaration
     930             : (tag_kind determines which).  Return TRUE if next_tok introduces a definition
     931             : for that type.  (next_tok is the current token or one that follows.)
     932             : is_ref_within_new_expr is TRUE if this occurs in a new-expression; in that
     933             : case, a colon is assumed to be part of a "?:" operator and not the beginning
     934             : of a base type specifier.  If no_definition_allowed is TRUE, always return
     935             : FALSE (e.g., in "[]()->struct X {}" the "{}" is assumed to be the body of the
     936             : lambda, not the definition of X).
     937             : */
     938             : {
     939       30607 :   a_boolean  result;
     940             : 
     941       30607 :   if (no_definition_allowed) {
     942             :     /* Note that FALSE is also returned if next_tok is a colon.  A colon is an
     943             :        error either way, but most likely the programmer did not intend a class
     944             :        definition in this context. */
     945             :     result = FALSE;
     946       30607 :   } else if (next_tok == tok_lbrace) {
     947             :     result = TRUE;
     948       16902 :   } else if (!C_mode() && next_tok == tok_colon && !is_ref_within_new_expr) {

     962           0 :         cache_curr_token(&cache);
     963           0 :         if (curr_token == tok_colon) break;
     964           0 :         check_assertion(curr_token != tok_end_of_source);

     966             :       }  /* for */
     967           0 :       (void)get_token();

     982             : 
     983             : 
     984        6549 : static void check_consistent_tag_kind(a_symbol_kind     tag_kind,
     985             :                                       a_symbol_ptr      *p_tag_sym,
     986             :                                       a_symbol_locator  *locator,
     987             :                                       a_scope_depth     *effective_decl_level,
     988             :                                       a_scope_depth     computed_decl_level,
     989             :                                       a_boolean         *err)
     990             : /*
     991             : A tag is being declared with the given tag kind, but a previous declaration of
     992             : that tag name exists (an recorded in *p_tag_sym).  Check that the new kind is
     993             : consistent with the previous tag and issue a diagnostic at the position
     994             : recorded in *locator otherwise.  If this is an error case, set *err to TRUE,
     995             : *p_tag_sym to NULL, and (in C++ and Microsoft modes) *effective_decl_level to
     996             : computed_decl_level.
     997             : This is a helper routine for scan_tag_name.
     998             : */
     999             : {
    1000        6549 :   a_symbol_ptr  tag_sym = *p_tag_sym;
    1001             : 
    1002        6549 :   if (tag_sym->kind != tag_kind) {
    1003           0 :     an_error_severity  severity;

    1005             :         tag_sym->kind != (a_symbol_kind)sk_enum_tag) {
    1006             :       /* Allow mixing of struct/class and union in cfront mode. */
    1007             :       severity = (an_error_severity)es_warning;
    1008             :     } else {
    1009           0 :       severity = (an_error_severity)es_error;
    1010           0 :       *err = TRUE;
    1011             :     }  /* if */
    1012           0 :     pos_stsy_diagnostic(severity, ec_tag_kind_incompatible_with_declaration,
    1013             :                         &locator->source_position,
    1014           0 :                         name_of_symbol_kind(tag_kind), tag_sym);
    1015           0 :     if (*err) {
    1016             :       /* Ignore the existing symbol. */
    1017           0 :       if (!C_mode() || microsoft_mode) {
    1018             :         /* Ensure that the caller will create the new type in an appropriate
    1019             :            scope. */
    1020           0 :         *effective_decl_level = computed_decl_level;
    1021             :       }  /* if */
    1022           0 :       *p_tag_sym = NULL;
    1023             :     }  /* if */
    1024             :   }  /* if */
    1025        6549 : }  /* check_consistent_tag_kind */
    1026             : 
    1027             : 
    1028             : #if !EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    1029             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* decl_pos_block is not used unless extra source-position
    1030             :                 information is being recorded in the IL. */
    1031             : #endif /* !EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    1032       13100 : static a_symbol_ptr scan_tag_name(a_symbol_kind     tag_kind,
    1033             :                                   a_symbol_locator  *locator,
    1034             :                                   a_boolean         *is_friend_decl,
    1035             :                                   a_boolean         is_specialization,
    1036             :                                   a_boolean         *check_for_vacuous_decl,
    1037             :                                   a_boolean         is_ref_within_new_expr,
    1038             :                                   a_boolean         no_definition_allowed,
    1039             :                                   a_boolean         is_event_interface,
    1040             :                                   a_scope_depth     *effective_decl_level,
    1041             :                                   a_boolean         *tag_resolution,
    1042             :                                   a_boolean         *is_predeclared_type_decl,
    1043             :                                   a_decl_pos_block  *decl_pos_block)
    1044             : /*
    1045             : Scan a tag identifier for a class, struct, union, enum, or interface
    1046             : declaration.  If a tag symbol already exists for the identifier, return
    1047             : a pointer to that symbol; otherwise return NULL.  If there is no
    1048             : identifier or if there is an error, return NULL; otherwise, set *locator
    1049             : to represent the identifier.  In Microsoft mode, the symbol returned
    1050             : may represent a class template when parsing a nonstandard friend template
    1051             : declaration (a declaration of the form "friend class X;" where X is the
    1052             : name of a template).
    1053             : 
    1054             : *is_friend_decl is TRUE when the declaration appears to be of the form
    1055             : "friend class X;"; if it turns out that no semicolon follows the identifier,
    1056             : however, the flag will be reset to FALSE and a normal lookup will be done.
    1057             : is_specialization is TRUE for calls done while scanning the tag name of a
    1058             : template explicit specialization.  *check_for_vacuous_decl is TRUE when the
    1059             : context permits a declaration like "struct x;".  is_ref_within_new_expr is
    1060             : TRUE when the declaration appears inside a new expression.
    1061             : no_definition_allowed is TRUE if no definition is considered in this context
    1062             : (e.g., if the declaration appears in a C++11 trailing return type).
    1063             : is_event_interface is TRUE if the __event keyword precedes the __interface
    1064             : keyword meaning that an "__event __interface" is being declared.
    1065             : *effective_decl_level will have been initialized to decl_scope_level by the
    1066             : caller; it may be changed in C++ for a forward reference to a tag within a
    1067             : function prototype or a class definition -- the tag is entered into the
    1068             : innermost non-class/non-prototype scope, which is returned as its effective
    1069             : declaration level.  *tag_resolution is returned TRUE if this is the
    1070             : definition of a previously declared incomplete class or enum.
    1071             : *is_predeclared_type_decl is returned TRUE if this is the explicit
    1072             : declaration of a predeclared type like type_info in C++ or _GUID in
    1073             : Microsoft mode.
    1074             : 
    1075             : This routine may look more complicated than is necessary -- it isn't.
    1076             : This routine can either be matching up a definition with a previous
    1077             : declaration or may be entering a definition in a new scope.  The lookups
    1078             : have to be done very carefully to create new entries only when required
    1079             : and to find existing entries only when appropriate.  Exercise great
    1080             : caution when modifying this routine.
    1081             : */
    1082             : {
    1083       13100 :   a_symbol_ptr               tag_sym = NULL, templ_sym = NULL;
    1084       13100 :   a_token_kind               next_tok;
    1085       13100 :   a_boolean                  err = FALSE, tag_err = FALSE;
    1086       13100 :   a_boolean                  is_tag_definition = FALSE, body_removed = FALSE;

    1088       13100 :   a_scope_depth              computed_decl_level = NO_SCOPE_DEPTH;
    1089       13100 :   a_boolean                  allow_typedef = FALSE;
    1090             :

    1326             :            refer to templates: These are treated as friend template
    1327             :            declarations.  For example:

    1331             :               };

    1334             :            injected template name.  I.e., the example above is not accepted,

    1735           0 :             underlying_type = type_symbol_type(tag_sym);

    1737           0 :             tag_sym = symbol_for(underlying_type);
    1738             :           }  /* if */
    1739             :         }  /* if */
    1740             :       }  /* if */
    1741             :     }  /* if */
    1742       10978 :     if (!tag_err && tag_sym != NULL) {
    1743        6549 :       check_consistent_tag_kind(tag_kind, &tag_sym, locator,
    1744             :                                 effective_decl_level, computed_decl_level,
    1745             :                                 &tag_err);
    1746             :     }  /* if */
    1747             :   }  /* if */
    1748        4429 : done:
    1749       13100 :   if (tag_err) {
    1750             :     /* If an error occurred while scanning the tag, make the locator that
    1751             :        is returned to the caller an error locator. */
    1752           0 :     set_to_error_locator(*locator);
    1753             :   }  /* if */
    1754             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    1755       13100 :   if (decl_pos_block != NULL) {
    1756             :     /* The end position of the current token is the end of the identifier
    1757             :        and (as far as we know so far) the end of the specifier to which the
    1758             :        class or enum declaration may belong. */
    1759       13100 :     decl_pos_block->identifier_range.end = end_pos_curr_token;
    1760       13100 :     decl_pos_block->specifiers_range.end = end_pos_curr_token;
    1761             :   }  /* if */
    1762             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    1763             :   /* Now that we have completed the lookup on the tag identifier we can
    1764             :      advance past it. */
    1765       13100 :   (void)get_token();
    1766       13100 :   db_exit();
    1767       13100 :   return tag_sym;
    1768             : }  /* scan_tag_name */

    1771        4105 : void set_name_linkage_for_type(a_type_ptr  tp)
    1772             : /*
    1773             : Set the name_linkage field of the class or enum type pointed to by tp.
    1774             : */

    1776        4105 :   a_source_correspondence  *scp = &tp->source_corresp;
    1777             : 
    1778        4105 :   check_assertion(is_immediate_class_type(tp) || is_immediate_enum_type(tp));
    1779        4105 :   if (!has_name(tp) || scp->is_local_to_function) {
    1780             :     /* Name linkage requires a nonlocal name.  (Note that this can change if
    1781             :        the type acquires a name through a typedef declaration.) */
    1782        1127 :     scp->name_linkage = (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_none;
    1783        2978 :   } else if (scp->is_class_member && !gpp_mode) {
    1784             :     /* A nested class or enum has the same linkage as the class of which it
    1785             :        is a member.  GNU C++ ignores the name linkage of the enclosing class;
    1786             :        e.g., a named class nested in an unnamed class has C++ name linkage. */
    1787           0 :     scp->name_linkage = scp_parent_class(scp)->source_corresp.name_linkage;
    1788        2978 :   } else if (any_cfront_mode() &&
    1789           0 :              depth_innermost_namespace_scope == DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE) {
    1790             :     /* In cfront mode -- unless this is a class or enum declared within a
    1791             :        namespace -- give it internal linkage by default.  It may be promoted
    1792             :        later, based on how it's used, etc. */
    1793           0 :     scp->name_linkage = (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_internal;
    1794             :   } else {
    1795             :     /* Ordinary default for classes and enums is C++ external linkage. */
    1796        2978 :     scp->name_linkage = (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_cplusplus_external;
    1797             :   }  /* if */
    1798        4105 : }  /* set_name_linkage_for_type */

    1800             : 
    1801        1559 : static a_boolean namespace_scope_should_be_pushed(
    1802             :                                 a_symbol_ptr            tag_sym,
    1803             :                                 a_source_position       *pos,
    1804             :                                 a_boolean               *err,
    1805             :                                 a_boolean               inline_namespace)
    1806             : /*
    1807             : The class or enum indicated by tag_sym is being defined, having originally
    1808             : been declared a namespace member.  Determine whether it's legal in this
    1809             : context (if not, issue a diagnostic and return *err set to TRUE), and if it
    1810             : is legal, determine whether a scope stack entry needs to be pushed (in which
    1811             : case return TRUE).  inline_namespace is TRUE if it is okay for tag_sym
    1812             : to be defined in an inline namespace of the namespace containing tag_sym.
    1813             : */
    1814             : {
    1815        1559 :   a_boolean    should_be_pushed = FALSE;
    1816        1559 :   a_scope_ptr  scope = scope_stack[decl_scope_level].il_scope;
    1817             : 
    1818        3118 :   if (inline_namespace &&
    1819        1559 :       is_symbol_from_inline_namespace(tag_sym)) {
    1820             :     /* Push a namespace extension scope. */
    1821             :     should_be_pushed = TRUE;
    1822        1559 :   } else if (!namespace_is_enclosed_by_curr_scope(tag_sym)) {
    1823             :     /* This declaration appears within a namespace scope in which the name
    1824             :        cannot be defined -- it is a member (directly or indirectly) of a
    1825             :        namespace that is not enclosed by the current namespace scope (see
    1826             :        WP 7.3.1.4). */
    1827           0 :     pos_sy_error(ec_bad_scope_for_definition, pos, tag_sym);
    1828           0 :     *err = TRUE;
    1829        1559 :   } else if (scope->kind != (a_scope_kind)sck_namespace ||
    1830        1559 :              sym_parent_namespace_or_null(tag_sym) !=
    1831        1559 :                                  scope->variant.assoc_namespace) {
    1832             :     /* Push a namespace extension scope. */
    1833           0 :     should_be_pushed = TRUE;
    1834             :   }  /* if */
    1835        1559 :   return should_be_pushed;
    1836             : }  /* namespace_scope_should_be_pushed */
    1837             : 
    1838             : 
    1839          64 : static void check_nested_class_redeclaration(
    1840             :                                  a_decl_parse_state      *dps,
    1841             :                                  a_symbol_ptr            tag_sym,
    1842             :                                  a_source_position       *tag_position,
    1843             :                                  a_boolean               is_class_definition,
    1844             :                                  a_boolean               is_friend_decl,
    1845             :                                  a_boolean               is_qualified_name,
    1846             :                                  a_boolean               *declares_something)
    1847             : /*
    1848             : Helper for class_specifier (below) that verifies whether the use of an 
    1849             : elaborated type-specifier is really a redeclaration, and if so performs
    1850             : various checks related to access and the use of a qualified name.
    1851             : This function is called if a class-specifier is seen in the scope of another
    1852             : class type, and the tag of that specifier was already declared in that scope.
    1853             : *dps describes the context of the elaborated name.  tag_sym is a pointer to
    1854             : the symbol associated with the elaborated name.  tag_position is the position
    1855             : of the elaborated name (tag) that was just scanned.  is_class_definition and
    1856             : is_friend_decl are set when the tag is used to define the nested type or
    1857             : introduce a friend declaration.  If the tag-name was qualified,
    1858             : is_qualified_name is set as well.  *declares_something is set to false if the
    1859             : elaborated type specifier does not introduce a definition and is not followed
    1860             : by a semicolon; otherwise it is left unchanged.
    1861             : */
    1862             : {
    1863          64 :   a_type_ptr  type = tag_sym->variant.class_struct_union.type;
    1864             : 
    1865          64 :   if (is_class_definition && is_qualified_name) {
    1866             :     /* Issue a warning on a case like this:
    1867             :          class A {
    1868             :            class N;
    1869             :            class A::N { ... };    // Qualified name is not allowed
    1870             :          };
    1871             :        -- a warning rather than an error for consistency with other
    1872             :        member declarations (see simplify_curr_class_qualified_name). */
    1873           0 :     pos_diagnostic(strict_ansi_mode ?
    1874             :                        strict_ansi_error_severity : es_warning,
    1875             :                    ec_qualifier_in_member_declaration, tag_position);
    1876             :   }  /* if */
    1877          64 :   if (!is_class_definition &&
    1878          64 :       (curr_token != tok_semicolon || dps->is_type_name)) {
    1879             :     /* For example:
    1880             :           struct S { struct N {}; private: struct N* f(); };
    1881             :        is fine -- there is no redeclaration of struct N here.  Similarly:
    1882             :           struct T { struct N {}; using R = struct N; }; */
    1883           0 :     *declares_something = FALSE;
    1884          64 :   } else if (!is_friend_decl) {
    1885             :     /* Be sure the access is consistent on the redeclaration. */
    1886           0 :     a_scope_stack_entry_ptr ssep = &scope_stack[depth_scope_stack];
    1887           0 :     if (ssep->current_access != type->source_corresp.access) {
    1888             :       /* The access specified for the previous declaration does not
    1889             :          correspond to the access for current declaration. */
    1890           0 :       an_error_code      error_code;
    1891           0 :       an_error_severity  severity;
    1892             : 
    1893             :       /* If this is a definition, use the current access instead of
    1894             :          that specified on the original declaration. */
    1895           0 :       if (is_class_definition) {
    1896           0 :         type->source_corresp.access = ssep->current_access;
    1897           0 :         error_code = ec_redecl_changes_access;
    1898             :       } else {
    1899             :         error_code = ec_cannot_change_access;
    1900             :       }  /* if */
    1901           0 :       severity = strict_ansi_mode ?
    1902           0 :                    strict_ansi_discretionary_severity : es_warning;
    1903           0 :       pos_sy_diagnostic(severity, error_code, tag_position, tag_sym);
    1904             :     }  /* if */
    1905           0 :     if ((tag_sym->defined || !is_class_definition) &&
    1906             :         /* Exclude ordinary (nonprototype) template instantiations: */
    1907           0 :         !(type->variant.class_struct_union.is_template_class &&
    1908             :           !type->variant.class_struct_union.is_prototype_instantiation &&
    1909             :           !type->variant.class_struct_union.is_specialized)) {
    1910             :       /* The only standard conforming nested class redeclaration is a
    1911             :          definition following a nondefining declaration. */
    1912           0 :       pos_diagnostic(strict_ansi_mode ?
    1913             :                        strict_ansi_error_severity : es_warning,
    1914             :                      ec_invalid_nested_class_redecl, tag_position);
    1915             : 
    1916             :     }  /* if */
    1917             :   }  /* if */
    1918          64 : } /* check_nested_class_redeclaration */
    1919             :

    1921           0 : static a_boolean same_entity_as_a_type_info_type(a_type_ptr type)

    1923             : Return true if "type" is the same entity as a type_info type.

    1939           0 : static void duplicate_friend_sym_in_namespace(a_scope_depth  *scope_depth,
    1940             :                                               a_symbol_ptr   *sym)
    1941             : /*
    1942             : The given symbol was created for a friend class declaration during a
    1943             : prototype instantiation.  It is therefore associated with a template
    1944             : instantiation scope.  Duplicate this symbol in the surrounding namespace
    1945             : scope, but keep it hidden in that scope until a visible declaration of
    1946             : the class is made (unless we are doing friend injection).  Update *sym to
    1947             : the duplicated symbol value and *scope_depth to the namespace scope in
    1948             : which it was added.
    1949             : */
    1950             : {
    1951           0 :   *scope_depth = depth_innermost_namespace_scope;
    1952           0 :   *sym = enter_copy_of_symbol(*sym, *scope_depth, /*suppress_error=*/FALSE);
    1953           0 :   if (!friend_class_injection_enabled) (*sym)->is_invisible = TRUE;
    1954           0 : }  /* duplicate_friend_sym_in_namespace */

    1956             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED

    1958             : static void decl_nonstandard_friend_template(a_symbol_ptr  sym)
    1959             : /*
    1960             : We've seen a friend declaration of the form "friend class X;" where X is a
    1961             : class template represented by sym.  In Microsoft and Sun modes, this is
    1962             : treated as a friend template declaration.  Update the IL as needed and issue
    1963             : an appropriate diagnostic.
    1964             : */
    1965             : {
    1966             :   a_scope_stack_entry_ptr  ssep = &scope_stack[depth_scope_stack];
    1967             :   a_template_symbol_supplement_ptr
    1968             :                            tssp = sym->variant.template_info;
    1969             :   a_template_ptr           tp;
    1970             : 
    1971             :   check_assertion(microsoft_mode || sun_mode);
    1972             :   /* Pragmas cannot bind to this "implicit template". */
    1973             :   cannot_bind_to_curr_construct();
    1974             :   if (ssep->kind != (a_scope_kind)sck_class_struct_union) {
    1975             :     pos_error(ec_bad_friend_decl, &locator_for_curr_id.source_position);
    1976             :     goto done;
    1977             :   }  /* if */
    1978             :   add_befriending_class_to_class_template(tssp, ssep->assoc_type);
    1979             :   pos_warning(ec_bad_friend_decl, &locator_for_curr_id.source_position);
    1980             :   /* Create an IL entry for the template.  This entry is special in the
    1981             :      sense that its template_decl field is NULL (since there were no
    1982             :      template parameters in the source). */
    1983             :   tp = alloc_template();
    1984             :   tp->kind = (a_template_kind)templk_class;
    1985             :   tp->source_corresp.assoc_info = (char*)sym;
    1986             :   set_source_corresp_name(&tp->source_corresp, sym->header);
    1987             :   tp->source_corresp.decl_position = locator_for_curr_id.source_position;
    1988             :   tp->source_corresp.name_linkage =
    1989             :                                   (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_cplusplus_external;
    1990             :   tp->source_corresp.access = ssep->current_access;
    1991             :   tp->canonical_template = tssp->il_template_entry->canonical_template;
    1992             :   tp->prototype_instantiation.type = tp->canonical_template
    1993             :                                        ->prototype_instantiation.type;
    1994             :   add_to_templates_list(tp, depth_innermost_namespace_scope);
    1995             : #if RECORD_TEMPLATE_STRINGS
    1996             :   /* This entry has no text representation because its tokens were not
    1997             :      cached. */
    1998             : #endif /* RECORD_TEMPLATE_STRINGS */

    2000             :   if (!source_sequence_entries_disallowed) {
    2001             :     a_src_seq_secondary_decl_ptr  sssdp;
    2002             :     add_to_source_sequence_list((char *)tp, (an_il_entry_kind)iek_template);

    2007             : done:;

    2009             : 
    2010             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    2011             : 
    2012             : #if !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    2013             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* is_template is only used for Microsoft emulation. */
    2014             : #endif /* !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    2015             : static void check_friend_class_declaration(a_symbol_locator  *locator,
    2016             :                                            a_symbol_ptr      *tag_sym,
    2017             :                                            a_boolean         *is_template)
    2018             : /*
    2019             : Check that a friend class declaration is well-formed.  locator describes the
    2020             : source construct to name the class and tag_sym describes the associated class.
    2021             : For error cases, *tag_sym is set to NULL and locator is turned into an error
    2022             : locator.  Microsoft compilers allow "friend class X;" where X is a template:
    2023             : That case is handled entirely by this routine, after which *is_template is set
    2024             : to TRUE.
    2025             : */
    2026             : {
    2027             :   if (!(gpp_mode || microsoft_mode) && locator->is_qualified_name &&
    2028             :       locator->specific_symbol->kind ==
    2029             :                                      (a_symbol_kind)sk_namespace_projection) {
    2030             :     /* Except in GNU and Microsoft C++ modes, a qualified friend declaration
    2031             :        that finds a using-declaration is an error. */
    2032             :     a_namespace_ptr  nsp = qualifier_namespace_ptr(*locator);
    2033             :     if (nsp == NULL) {
    2034             :       /* Must be something like this:
    2035             :            namespace N { class X; }
    2036             :            using N::X;
    2037             :            class Y {
    2038             :              friend class ::X;      // Error
    2039             :            };
    2040             :       */
    2041             :       check_assertion(locator->is_file_scope_qualified_name);
    2042             :       pos_st_error(ec_name_not_tag_in_file_scope,
    2043             :                    &locator->source_position,
    2044             :                    locator->symbol_header->identifier);
    2045             :     } else {
    2046             :       /* Must be something like this:
    2047             :            namespace N { class X; }
    2048             :            namespace M { using N::X; }
    2049             :            class Y {
    2050             :              friend class M::X;     // Error
    2051             :            };
    2052             :       */
    2053             :       pos_stsy_error(ec_not_an_actual_member, &locator->source_position,
    2054             :                      locator->symbol_header->identifier,
    2055             :                      (a_symbol_ptr)nsp->source_corresp.assoc_info);
    2056             :     }  /* if */
    2057             :     set_to_named_error_locator(*locator);
    2058             :     *tag_sym = NULL;
    2059             :   } else if ((gpp_mode || microsoft_mode) && (*tag_sym)->is_nonreal_member) {
    2060             :     a_type_ptr  parent_type = (*tag_sym)->parent.class_type;
    2061             :     /* Microsoft and g++ allows a friend declaration that refers to
    2062             :        an undeclared member of a prototype instantiation.  Check for
    2063             :        this case and issue a diagnostic if needed. */
    2064             :     check_for_invalid_friend_declaration(parent_type, *tag_sym, locator);
    2065             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    2066             :   } else if (is_class_template_symbol(*tag_sym)) {
    2067             :     /* Microsoft and Sun compilers accept "friend class X;" where X is a class
    2068             :        template.  It is treated as a friend template declaration. */
    2069             :     decl_nonstandard_friend_template(*tag_sym);
    2070             :     *is_template = TRUE;
    2071             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    2072             :   }  /* if */
    2073             : }  /* check_friend_class_declaration */

    2075             : 
    2076           0 : static void check_name_used_for_qualified_class_definition(
    2077             :                                                        a_symbol_locator  *loc,
    2078             :                                                        a_symbol_ptr      sym)
    2079             : /*
    2080             : sym represents a class being defined in strict mode using a qualified name
    2081             : represented by loc.  If sym represents a nested class and the class type used
    2082             : to qualify the nested class name does not directly contain the nested class
    2083             : (i.e., the nested class is inherited instead), issue an error.  For example:
    2084             :   struct B { struct N; };
    2085             :   struct D: B {}:
    2086             :   struct D::N {};  // Error in strict mode.
    2087             : 
    2088             : Similarly, if sym represents a namespace scope class defined in a namespace
    2089             : that is different from the namespace indicated by the qualifier (due to a
    2090             : using-declaration), issue an error.  For example:
    2091             :   namespace N { struct S; }
    2092             :   namespace M { using N::S; }
    2093             :   struct M::S {};  // Error in strict mode.
    2094             : 
    2095             : A symbol from an inline namespace can be defined as if it were a member of
    2096             : the enclosing namespace:
    2097             :   namespace N {
    2098             :     inline namespace I {
    2099             :       struct A;
    2100             :     }
    2101             :   }
    2102             :   struct N::A {};  // Okay
    2103             : */
    2104             : {
    2105           0 :   if (sym->is_class_member) {
    2106           0 :     a_type_ptr  qualifier_class = qualifier_class_type(*loc);
    2107             :     /* A nested class definition. */
    2108           0 :     check_assertion(loc->is_class_member);
    2109           0 :     if (!same_entities(qualifier_class, sym_parent_class(sym))) {
    2110           0 :       pos_ty_diagnostic(strict_ansi_discretionary_severity,
    2111             :                         ec_bad_qualifier_for_nested_class_decl,
    2112             :                         &loc->source_position,
    2113           0 :                         type_symbol_type(sym));
    2114             :     }  /* if */
    2115             :   } else {
    2116             :     /* A namespace scope class definition. */
    2117           0 :     a_namespace_ptr  qualifier_nsp;
    2118           0 :     check_assertion(!loc->is_class_member);
    2119           0 :     qualifier_nsp = qualifier_namespace_ptr(*loc);
    2120           0 :     if (!same_entities(qualifier_nsp, sym_parent_namespace_or_null(sym)) &&
    2121           0 :         !is_symbol_from_inline_namespace(sym)) {
    2122           0 :       pos_ty_diagnostic(strict_ansi_discretionary_severity,
    2123             :                         ec_bad_qualifier_for_delayed_class_definition,
    2124             :                         &loc->source_position,
    2125           0 :                         type_symbol_type(sym));
    2126             :     }  /* if */
    2127             :   }  /* if */
    2128           0 : }  /* check_name_used_for_qualified_class_definition */
    2129             : 
    2130             : #if SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    2131             : 
    2132             : static void scan_link_scope_specifier(a_decl_flag_set         input_flags,
    2133             :                                       a_decl_modifiers_block  *decl_modifiers)
    2134             : /*
    2135             : The current token corresponds to a Sun link scope specifier.  Update
    2136             : decl_modifiers to reflect the specifier if appropriate.  Issue an error if
    2137             : there are several such specifiers on the current declaration or if the
    2138             : specifiers appear on a parameter declaration.  input_flags is the flag set
    2139             : passed to the call to decl_specifiers.
    2140             : */
    2141             : {
    2142             :   if (input_flags & DSI_IS_PARAMETER) {
    2143             :     pos_error(ec_parameter_with_link_scope_specifier, &error_position);
    2144             :   } else if (decl_modifiers->flags & DM_ANY_SUN_LINK_SCOPE) {
    2145             :     pos_error(ec_multiple_link_scope_specifiers, &error_position);
    2146             :   } else {
    2147             :     switch (curr_token) {
    2148             :       case tok_global_link_scope:
    2149             :         decl_modifiers->flags |= DM_GLOBAL_LINK_SCOPE;
    2150             :         break;
    2151             :       case tok_symbolic_link_scope:
    2152             :         decl_modifiers->flags |= DM_SYMBOLIC_LINK_SCOPE;
    2153             :         break;
    2154             :       case tok_hidden_link_scope:
    2155             :         decl_modifiers->flags |= DM_HIDDEN_LINK_SCOPE;
    2156             :         break;
    2157             :       default:
    2158             :         unexpected_condition();
    2159             :     }  /* if */
    2160             :   }  /* if */
    2161             : }  /* scan_link_scope_specifier */
    2162             : 
    2163             : 
    2164             : static void record_sun_link_scope_for_class(a_type_ptr              class_type,
    2165             :                                             a_decl_modifier         link_scope,
    2166             :                                             a_source_position       *err_pos)
    2167             : /*
    2168             : The given class type is declared with the given link scope.  Record the new
    2169             : link scope value, but issue an error at the given position if it loosens a
    2170             : previous specification.  For example:
    2171             :         class __hidden X *p;
    2172             :         class __global X {};  // Error.
    2173             : */
    2174             : {
    2175             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr  ctsp = class_type_supp(class_type);
    2176             : 
    2177             :   if (link_scope < (ctsp->decl_modifiers & DM_ANY_SUN_LINK_SCOPE)) {
    2178             :     pos_error(ec_link_scope_relaxation, err_pos);
    2179             :   }  /* if */
    2180             :   ctsp->decl_modifiers &= ~(a_decl_modifier)DM_ANY_SUN_LINK_SCOPE;
    2181             :   ctsp->decl_modifiers |= link_scope;

    2183             :

    2185             : 
    2186       11023 : void scan_class_modifiers(a_type_kind  type_kind,
    2187             :                           a_boolean    *p_is_final,
    2188             :                           a_boolean    *p_is_abstract,
    2189             :                           a_boolean    *p_is_sealed)
    2190             : /*
    2191             : Scan the (context-sensitive) keywords "final", "abstract", and "sealed" and
    2192             : record their presence through the given pointers: *p_is_final is set to TRUE if
    2193             : "final" or "sealed" is encountered, *p_is_abstract is set to TRUE if "abstract"
    2194             : is encountered, and *p_is_sealed is set to TRUE if "sealed" is encountered.
    2195             : Duplicate specifiers are diagnosed as discretionary errors.  type_kind
    2196             : indicates whether the modifiers are applied to a struct, union, or class type.
    2197             : An error is issued if the "abstract" or "sealed" appear in a union definition.
    2198             : */
    2199             : {
    2200       11023 :   a_boolean  union_error_issued = FALSE;
    2201       11023 :   a_boolean  is_final = FALSE, is_abstract = FALSE, is_sealed = FALSE;
    2202             : 
    2203       11023 :   for (;;) {
    2204       11023 :     if (curr_token == tok_final) {
    2205           0 :       if (is_final) {
    2206           0 :         diagnostic(es_discretionary_error, ec_duplicate_class_modifier);
    2207             :       } else {
    2208             :         is_final = TRUE;
    2209             :       }  /* if */
    2210             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    2211             :     } else if (curr_token == tok_abstract) {
    2212             :       if (is_abstract) {
    2213             :         diagnostic(es_discretionary_error, ec_duplicate_class_modifier);
    2214             :       } else {
    2215             :         is_abstract = TRUE;
    2216             :       }  /* if */
    2217             :     }  else if (curr_token == tok_sealed) {
    2218             :       if (is_sealed) {
    2219             :         diagnostic(es_discretionary_error, ec_duplicate_class_modifier);
    2220             :       } else {
    2221             :         is_sealed = TRUE;
    2222             :       }  /* if */
    2223             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    2224             :     } else {
    2225             :       break;
    2226             :     }  /* if */
    2227           0 :     if (type_kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union && (is_sealed || is_abstract) &&
    2228             :         !union_error_issued) {
    2229             :       pos_error(ec_abstract_or_sealed_on_union, &error_position);
    2230             :       union_error_issued = TRUE;
    2231             :     }  /* if */
    2232           0 :     (void)get_token();
    2233             :   }  /* for */

    2273           0 : static a_boolean delayed_nested_class_allowed_in_class(a_symbol_ptr  sym)
    2274             : /*
    2275             : Some GNU and Microsoft compilers accept delayed nested class definitions in
    2276             : certain class scopes.  For example:
    2277             :     struct A {
    2278             :       struct B {
    2279             :         struct C;
    2280             :       };
    2281             :       struct B::C {};  // Accepted in some Microsoft and GNU modes.
    2282             :     };
    2283             : This routine returns TRUE if the current scope is a class scope and if the
    2284             : nested class type represented by sym can be defined in that scope.  Otherwise,
    2285             : it returns FALSE.

    2287             : {
    2288           0 :   a_boolean  result = FALSE;

    2292             :        allowed.  The is_any_template_instance_class_symbol test is used to
    2293             :        prevent an instantiation from being treated as a delayed nested class
    2294             :        definition. */

    2296           0 :         scope_stack[depth_scope_stack].kind ==
    2297           0 :                                        (a_scope_kind)sck_class_struct_union &&
    2298           0 :         !is_proxy_class(type_symbol_type(sym)) &&
    2299           0 :         !is_any_template_instance_class_symbol(sym)) {
    2300             :       /* Check that the current scope encloses sym (not required for earlier
    2301             :          Microsoft versions). */
    2302           0 :       if ((microsoft_bugs && microsoft_version < 1400) ||
    2303           0 :           (gpp_mode && gnu_version < 30300)) {
    2304             :         result = TRUE;
    2305             :       } else {
    2306           0 :         a_symbol_ptr  curr_class_sym =
    2307           0 :                         symbol_for(scope_stack[depth_scope_stack].assoc_type);

    2382             : static void record_unresolved_type(an_assembly_scope_index  asm_idx,
    2383             :                                    a_cpp_cli_token          type_tok,
    2384             :                                    a_type_ptr               *result)
    2385             : /*
    2386             : Return in *result the unresolved type entry associated with the given assembly

    2388             : create one.

    2424             : 
    2425             : a_type_ptr scan_unresolved_metadata_type(void)
    2426             : /*
    2427             : Scan a construct of the form
    2428             :     __unresolved_type ( <assembly/scope-index> , <type-token> , <type-name> )
    2429             : where the first two arguments are integer constants, and the third is a string
    2430             : literal.  This construct is generated from C++/CLI metadata to denote a
    2431             : type that is referred to in that metadata, but which is declared in another
    2432             : assembly that hasn't been loaded (yet).
    2433             : Return a class type with CLI class type kind cctk_unresolved.
    2434             : */
    2435             : {
    2436             :   a_type_ptr  result;
    2437             : 
    2438             :   /* Skip over the __unresolved_type token. */
    2439             :   check_assertion(curr_token == tok_unresolved_type);
    2440             :   (void)get_token();
    2441             :   /* A '(' should be next. */
    2442             :   if (required_token(tok_lparen, ec_exp_lparen)) {
    2443             :     an_assembly_scope_index  assembly_scope_index = 0;
    2444             :     a_cpp_cli_token          metadata_type_def_token = 0;
    2445             :     a_source_position        arg_pos;
    2446             :     a_constant_ptr           con = local_constant();
    2447             :     a_boolean                ovflo;
    2448             :     arg_pos = pos_curr_token;
    2449             :     add_stop_token(tok_rparen);
    2450             :     add_stop_token(tok_comma);
    2451             :     /* Scan the first argument, which should be an integer constant. */
    2452             :     scan_integral_constant_expression(con);
    2453             :     if (is_error_constant(con)) {
    2454             :       expect_error();
    2455             :     } else if (con->kind != (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer) {
    2456             :       pos_error(ec_exp_int_constant, &arg_pos);
    2457             :     } else {
    2458             :       assembly_scope_index = (an_assembly_scope_index)
    2459             :                              unsigned_value_of_integer_constant(con, &ovflo);

    2463             :     /* Scan the second argument, which should also be an integer constant. */
    2464             :     scan_integral_constant_expression(con);
    2465             :     if (is_error_constant(con)) {
    2466             :       expect_error();
    2467             :     } else if (con->kind != (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer) {

    2479             :       metadata_type_def_token = 0;

    2481             :     if (metadata_type_def_token == 0 || assembly_scope_index == 0) {
    2482             :       result = error_type();

    2485             :                              &result);

    2490             :     remove_stop_token(tok_rparen);

    2493             :     /* __unresolved_type not followed by a parenthesis. */
    2494             :     result = error_type();

    2496             :   return result;
    2497             : }  /* scan_unresolved_metadata_type */
    2498             : 
    2499             : 
    2500             : an_assembly_visibility scan_cli_visibility_specifier_if_any(
    2501             :                                                        a_source_position  *pos)
    2502             : /*
    2503             : If the current token is "public" or "private" scan past it, set *pos to its
    2504             : position, and return av_public or av_private accordingly.  Otherwise, return
    2505             : av_none and leave *pos unchanged.  (Called in C++/CLI mode only.)
    2506             : */
    2507             : {
    2508             :   an_assembly_visibility  result = (an_assembly_visibility)av_none;
    2509             : 
    2510             :   if (is_cli_assembly_visibility_specifier(curr_token)) {
    2511             :     *pos = pos_curr_token;
    2512             :     switch (curr_token) {
    2513             :       case tok_public:   result = (an_assembly_visibility)av_public;   break;
    2514             :       case tok_private:  result = (an_assembly_visibility)av_private;  break;
    2515             :       default:           unexpected_condition();
    2516             :     }  /* switch */
    2517             :     *pos = pos_curr_token;
    2518             :     /* Scan past the visibility specifier token. */
    2519             :     (void)get_token();
