    2521             :       /* Multiple specifiers are an error. */
    2522             :       pos_error(ec_multiple_visibility_specifiers, &pos_curr_token);
    2523             :       do {
    2524             :         (void)get_token();
    2525             :       } while (curr_token == tok_public || curr_token == tok_private);
    2526             :     }  /* if */
    2527             :   }  /* if */
    2528             :   return result;
    2529             : }  /* scan_cli_visibility_specifier_if_any */
    2530             : 
    2531             : 
    2532             : void set_cli_visibility(a_type_ptr              type,
    2533             :                         an_assembly_visibility  declared_visibility,
    2534             :                         a_source_position_ptr   diag_pos,
    2535             :                         a_boolean               is_definition)
    2536             : /*
    2537             : type represents a class or enum type whose specifier was just scanned.
    2538             : Determine the C++/CLI assembly visibility of this type.  If a C++/CLI
    2539             : visibility was explicitly specified, declared_visibility indicates whether it
    2540             : was "public" or "private".  Otherwise, declared_visibility is av_none.  If the
    2541             : type declaration is a definition, is_definition is TRUE.  Issue diagnostics as
    2542             : appropriate at the position indicated by diag_pos.  (Called in C++/CLI mode
    2543             : only.)
    2544             : */
    2545             : {
    2546             :   an_assembly_visibility  vis = (an_assembly_visibility)av_private;
    2547             : 
    2548             :   check_assertion(cli_or_cx_enabled);
    2549             :   if (declared_visibility != (an_assembly_visibility)av_none) {
    2550             :     /* An explicitly specified visibility: Ensure this is a top-level
    2551             :        definition. */
    2552             :     if (type->source_corresp.is_class_member) {
    2553             :       pos_error(ec_visibility_specifier_on_nested_type, diag_pos);
    2554             :     } else if (!is_definition) {
    2555             :       pos_error(ec_visibility_specifier_requires_definition, diag_pos);
    2556             :     } else {
    2557             :       vis = declared_visibility;
    2558             :     }  /* if */
    2559             :   }  /* if */
    2560             :   if (is_definition) {
    2561             :     /* Set the visibility in the IL entry. */
    2562             :     if (type->source_corresp.is_class_member) {
    2563             :       /* If the current member assembly access is private, then the nested
    2564             :          class is assembly-private; otherwise, the visibility of the parent
    2565             :          applies. */
    2566             :       if (scope_stack_top().current_assembly_access ==
    2567             :                                             (an_access_specifier)as_private) {
    2568             :         vis = (an_assembly_visibility)av_private;
    2569             :       } else {
    2570             :         vis = get_assembly_visibility_of(parent_class_of(type));
    2571             :       }  /* if */
    2572             :     }  /* if */
    2573             :     if (is_immediate_class_type(type)) {
    2574             :       class_type_supp(type)->declared_assembly_visibility =
    2575             :                                                           declared_visibility;
    2576             :       class_type_supp(type)->assembly_visibility = vis;
    2577             :     } else {
    2578             :       check_assertion(type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_integer);
    2579             :       integer_type_supp(type)->declared_assembly_visibility =
    2580             :                                                           declared_visibility;
    2581             :       integer_type_supp(type)->assembly_visibility = vis;
    2582             :     }  /* if */
    2583             :   }  /* if */
    2584             : }  /* set_cli_visibility */
    2585             : 
    2586             : 
    2587             : static void check_interface_redeclaration(a_symbol_ptr       prev_decl,
    2588             :                                           a_symbol_kind      tag_kind,
    2589             :                                           a_boolean          *is_interface,
    2590             :                                           a_boolean          is_definition,
    2591             :                                           a_source_position  *tag_pos)
    2592             : /*
    2593             : Verify that previous declarations of a class (represented by prev_decl) are
    2594             : consistent in their use of the Microsoft keyword "__interface".  Issue a
    2595             : diagnostic otherwise.  tag_kind, *is_interface, is_definition, and *tag_pos
    2596             : describe properties of the current declaration.  *is_interface is set to FALSE
    2597             : if the type should not be treated as an interface.
    2598             : */
    2599             : {
    2600             :   a_type_ptr  class_type = prev_decl->variant.class_struct_union.type;
    2601             : 
    2602             :   if (*is_interface != class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_interface) {
    2603             :     /* Only the first declaration and the definition of an interface must use
    2604             :        the __interface keyword.  Other declarations can use "struct" or "class"
    2605             :        (but not "union").  Furthermore, if the first declaration uses
    2606             :        "__interface" and the definition does not, the code is accepted but the
    2607             :        type is not an interface type. */
    2608             :     an_error_severity  sev = es_warning;
    2609             :     a_boolean          no_interface = FALSE;
    2610             :     if (tag_kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_union_tag ||
    2611             :         class_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union) {
    2612             :       sev = es_error;
    2613             :       no_interface = TRUE;
    2614             :     } else if (is_definition) {
    2615             :       if (*is_interface) {
    2616             :         /* The current declaration is a definition using the "__interface"
    2617             :            keyword but the first declaration did not use that keyword:
    2618             :            Microsoft compilers diagnose this, unless the prior declaration was
    2619             :            a "struct" (as opposed to a "class" or "union").  We emulate that
    2620             :            behavior, and proceed with an interface type even in the error
    2621             :            cases. */
    2622             :         if (class_type->kind != (a_type_kind)tk_struct) {
    2623             :           sev = es_error;
    2624             :         }  /* if */
    2625             :         class_type->kind = (a_type_kind)tk_struct;
    2626             :         class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_interface = TRUE;
    2627             :         class_type->variant.class_struct_union.abstract = TRUE;
    2628             :       } else {
    2629             :         /* The definition does not use the "__interface" keyword: Don't
    2630             :            treat the type as an interface. */
    2631             :         no_interface = TRUE;
    2632             :       }  /* if */
    2633             :     }  /* if */
    2634             :     pos_stsy_diagnostic(sev, ec_tag_kind_incompatible_with_declaration,
    2635             :                         tag_pos, name_of_symbol_kind(tag_kind), prev_decl);
    2636             :     if (no_interface) {
    2637             :       class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_interface = FALSE;
    2638             :       class_type->variant.class_struct_union.abstract = FALSE;
    2639             :       *is_interface = FALSE;
    2640             :     }  /* if */
    2641             :   }  /* if */
    2642             : }  /* check_interface_redeclaration */
    2643             : 
    2644             : 
    2645             : static void move_declspec_align_attr(an_attribute_ptr  *p_prefix_attributes, 
    2646             :                                      an_attribute_ptr  *p_tag_attributes)
    2647             : /*
    2648             : Move "__declspec(align(...))" attributes on the *p_prefix_attributes to the
    2649             : head of the list pointed to by *p_tag_attributes (the moved attributes are
    2650             : reclassified as al_tag_name).
    2651             : */
    2652             : {
    2653             :   an_attribute_ptr  moved = NULL, *p_end_moved = &moved;
    2654             : 
    2655             :   /* Collect the "__declspec(align(...))" attributes. */
    2656             :   while (*p_prefix_attributes != NULL) {
    2657             :     an_attribute_ptr  ap = *p_prefix_attributes;
    2658             :     if (ap->kind == (a_byte_attribute_kind)ak_align &&
    2659             :         ap->family == (a_byte_attribute_family)af_ms_declspec) {
    2660             :       ap->syntactic_location = (a_byte_attribute_location)al_tag_name;
    2661             :       *p_end_moved = ap;
    2662             :       p_end_moved = &ap->next;
    2663             :       *p_prefix_attributes = ap->next;
    2664             :     } else {
    2665             :       p_prefix_attributes = &ap->next;
    2666             :     }  /* if */
    2667             :   }  /* while */
    2668             :   /* Prepend the collected attributes to the *p_tag_attributes list. */
    2669             :   *p_end_moved = *p_tag_attributes;
    2670             :   *p_tag_attributes = moved;
    2671             : }  /* move_declspec_align_attr */
    2672             : 
    2673             : 
    2674             : static void preapply_microsoft_class_align_attribute(
    2675             :                                      a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
    2676             :                                      a_boolean            is_class_definition)
    2677             : /*
    2678             : The Microsoft __declspec(align(...)) attribute applied to a class type behaves
    2679             : differently from other __declspec attributes.  If necessary, adjust the
    2680             : dps->tag_attributes, dps->prefix_attributes, and dps->specifier_attributes
    2681             : lists to achieve the same effect as Microsoft compilers.  A diagnostic may be
    2682             : issued in some cases.
    2683             : */
    2684             : {
    2685             :   if (is_class_definition) {
    2686             :     /* Microsoft compilers treat
    2687             :          __declspec(align(N)) struct __declspec(...) X { ... };
    2688             :        as
    2689             :          struct __declspec(align(N), ...) X { ... };
    2690             :        (and this is specific to the "align" attributes).  Emulate this behavior
    2691             :        by moving "__declspec(align(...))" attributes on dps->prefix_attributes
    2692             :        and dps->specifier_attributes to the head of the list pointed to by
    2693             :        dps->tag_attributes (the moved attributes are reclassified as
    2694             :        al_tag_name).
    2695             :     */
    2696             :     if (dps->prefix_attributes != NULL) {
    2697             :       move_declspec_align_attr(&dps->prefix_attributes, &dps->tag_attributes);
    2698             :     }
    2699             :     if (dps->specifier_attributes != NULL) {
    2700             :       move_declspec_align_attr(&dps->specifier_attributes,
    2701             :                                &dps->tag_attributes);
    2702             :     }
    2703             :   } else {
    2704             :     an_attribute_ptr  ap = dps->tag_attributes;
    2705             :     for (; ap != NULL; ap = ap->next) {
    2706             :       if (ap->kind == (a_byte_attribute_kind)ak_align &&
    2707             :           ap->family == (a_byte_attribute_family)af_ms_declspec) {
    2708             :         pos_st_warning(ec_attribute_ignored_on_nondefinition, &ap->position,
    2709             :                        ap->name);
    2710             :         make_attr_unrecognized(ap);
    2711             :       }  /* if */
    2712             :     }  /* for */
    2713             :   }  /* if */
    2714             : }  /* preapply_microsoft_class_align_attribute */
    2715             : 
    2716             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    2717             : 
    2718           0 : static a_type_ptr scan_edg_internal_type()

    2858        7384 : void update_membership_of_class(a_symbol_ptr       tag_sym,
    2859             :                                 a_boolean          def_or_vacuous_decl,
    2860             :                                 a_boolean          is_event_interface,
    2861             :                                 a_scope_depth      decl_level,
    2862             :                                 a_source_position  *diag_pos)
    2863             : /*
    2864             : The given class/struct/union symbol has just been created.  Record its class
    2865             : or namespace membership if appropriate.  In C++ mode, also set its name
    2866             : linkage if necessary.  A few other related peripheral fields are set by this
    2867             : routine.  def_or_vacuous_decl is TRUE if this is a definition or a vacuous
    2868             : declaration.  is_event_interface is TRUE if the symbol represents an "__event

    2870             : appears.  Diagnostics may be emitted at the given position.

    3000             : 
    3001             : 
    3002        1544 : void attach_tag_attributes(an_attribute_ptr    attributes,
    3003             :                            a_type_ptr          type,
    3004             :                            a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
    3005             :                            a_boolean           is_definition,
    3006             :                            a_boolean           is_forward_decl,
    3007             :                            a_boolean           ignore_gnu_attributes)
    3008             : /*
    3009             : The given attributes were specified on the given type after a "class", "enum",
    3010             : "struct", or "union" keyword.  Attach and apply the attributes to the type.
    3011             : If is_definition is TRUE, the attributes appeared on the type definition.  If
    3012             : is_forward_decl is TRUE, the attributes appeared on an autonomous forward
    3013             : declaration; i.e., something like:
    3014             :   class [[]] X;
    3015             : rather than e.g.
    3016             :   class [[]] X *p;
    3017             : If ignore_gnu_attributes is TRUE, turn any recognized GNU attributes into
    3018             : ak_unrecognized attributes (which means they will have no further effect), and
    3019             : issue a warning.
    3020             : *dps describes the declaration that is being parsed.  dps is NULL if the
    3021             : attributes are attached as part of the template instantiation process.
    3022             : 
    3023             : Note that this call is typically followed by a call to
    3024             : record_strongest_alignment_attr to finalize any standard alignment attributes
    3025             : (but that call isn't performed here because it is also necessary at the end of
    3026             : a declaration/definition to check for cases where a required attribute is
    3027             : missing).
    3028             : */
    3029             : {
    3030        1544 :   a_boolean         gnu_warning_emitted = FALSE, std_error_emitted = FALSE;
    3031        1544 :   an_attribute_ptr  ap;
    3032             : 
    3033        1544 :   if (is_error_type(type)) {
    3034             :     /* Nothing to do (i.e., silently ignore the attributes). */
    3035        1544 :   } else if (is_template_param_type(type)) {
    3036             :     /* We can get here in some nonstandard cases like "enum [[]] T x;" where T
    3037             :        is a template parameter.  Ignore the attributes (with a warning). */
    3038           0 :     if (attributes != NULL) {
    3039           0 :       pos_warning(ec_attributes_ignored, &attributes->position);
    3040             :     }  /* if */
    3041             :   } else {
    3042        1544 :     check_assertion(is_immediate_class_type(type) ||
    3043             :                     is_immediate_enum_type(type));
    3044             :     /* Traverse the attribute list and record whether the attribute was on a

    3143        7913 : static void update_sse_for_first_tag_declaration(
    3144             :                                               a_type_ptr        tag_type,
    3145             :                                               a_symbol_locator  *locator,
    3146             :                                               a_boolean         is_definition,
    3147             :                                               a_boolean         gnu_extension)
    3148             : /*
    3149             : tag_type is being declared for the first time (and defined if is_definition
    3150             : is TRUE).  The name used in the source is described by *locator.  A source
    3151             : sequence entry was already created for it: Update that source sequence entry
    3152             : if needed (as well as an associated name reference entry if appropriate).
    3153             : gnu_extension is TRUE if the class was declared with the GNU keyword
    3154             : __extension__.
    3155             : */
    3156             : {
    3157        7913 :   a_name_reference_ptr  name_ref = NULL;
    3158             : 
    3159        7913 :   if (record_name_references_in_context()) {
    3160        1958 :     name_ref = qualifiable_name_reference(locator, &tag_type->source_corresp);
    3161             :   }  /* if */
    3162        7913 :   if (!is_definition) {
    3163             :     /* Set the first_declaration flag in the associated source-sequence
    3164             :        secondary declaration entry.  The corresponding field in the class
    3165             :        symbol supplement will already have been set for definitions, if
    3166             :        appropriate. */
    3167         784 :     an_sssd_flag_set  flags = SSSD_FIRST_DECLARATION;
    3168             : #if TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATIONS_IN_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    3169         784 :     if (curr_token == tok_removed_template_body) {
    3170             :       /* In code like "struct S { struct N {} *p; };" N is a nested non-
    3171             :          autonomous class type.  In the similar "struct S { struct N *p; };"
    3172             :          it is a namespace-scope class.  When representing template instances
    3173             :          in source sequence lists, the former can end up as the latter if
    3174             :          no care is taken.  For example:
    3175             :            template<class T> struct S { struct N {} *p; };
    3176             :            S<int> s;
    3177             :          doesn't instantiate S<int>::N and would therefore result in a
    3178             :          specialization like:
    3179             :            template<> struct S { struct N *p; };
    3180             :          To avoid that, we mark the nested class as autonomous, which is
    3181             :          equivalent to rewriting the specialization as:
    3182             :            template<> struct S { struct N; N *p; };
    3183             :          We also record that this was originally a non-autonomous definition
    3184             :          to ensure that source sequence entries of a later full instance are
    3185             :          inserted at the right location. */
    3186           0 :       check_assertion(tag_type->source_corresp.is_class_member);
    3187             :       flags |= SSSD_AUTONOMOUS_TAG_DECL |
    3188             :                SSSD_ORIGINALLY_NONAUTONOMOUS_DEFINITION;
    3189             :     }  /* if */
    3190             : #endif /* TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATIONS_IN_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    3191             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    3192         784 :     if (gnu_extension) {
    3193           0 :       flags |= SSSD_MARKED_AS_GNU_EXTENSION;
    3194             :     }  /* if */
    3195             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    3196         784 :     (void)set_src_seq_secondary_decl_fields((char*)tag_type, (a_type*)NULL,
    3197             :                                             name_ref, flags);
    3198             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    3199             :   } else {
    3200        7129 :     if (name_ref != NULL) {
    3201        1637 :       name_ref->used_in_primary_declarator = TRUE;
    3202             :     }  /* if */
    3203        7129 :     tag_type->source_corresp.marked_as_gnu_extension = gnu_extension;
    3204             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    3205             :   }  /* if */
    3206        7913 : }  /* update_sse_for_first_tag_declaration */

    3297       16054 : static a_boolean class_specifier(a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
    3298             :                                  a_decl_flag_set     dsi_flags,
    3299             :                                  a_boolean           vacuous_decl_allowed,
    3300             :                                  a_boolean           is_friend_decl,
    3301             :                                  a_boolean           marked_as_gnu_extension,
    3302             :                                  a_type_ptr          *type_ptr,
    3303             :                                  a_boolean           *declares_something,
    3304             :                                  a_boolean           *defines_something,
    3305             :                                  a_decl_pos_block    *decl_pos_block)
    3306             : /*
    3307             : Scan a class-specifier, which declares a class type (class/struct/union).  This
    3308             : function also handles Microsoft __interface declarations (treated as a special
    3309             : kind of struct).
    3310             : *dps tracks information about the current declaration.  dsi_flags is the set
    3311             : of input flags passed to decl_specifiers.  vacuous_decl_allowed is TRUE if the
    3312             : class specifier can be immediately followed by a semicolon and not include a
    3313             : definition.  is_friend_decl is TRUE if the "friend" keyword appeared before the
    3314             : class specifier.  marked_as_gnu_extension is TRUE if the GNU __extension__
    3315             : keyword is present.  The type is returned in *type_ptr. *declares_something is
    3316             : set to indicate whether or not this specifier declares something, and
    3317             : *defines_something to indicate whether the class/struct/union is actually
    3318             : defined.  Detailed position information is recorded in *decl_pos_block.
    3319             : */
    3320             : {
    3321       16054 :   a_symbol_kind           tag_kind = (a_symbol_kind)sk_class_or_struct_tag;

    3325       16054 :   a_symbol_ptr            parent_sym;

    4847             : void scan_and_record_event_interface_declaration(a_decl_parse_state *dps,
    4848             :                                                  a_type_ptr         class_type)
    4849             : /*
    4850             : Handle an "__event __interface" declaration in (a COM) class_type.
    4851             : */
    4852             : {
    4853             :   a_boolean         declares_something, defines_something;
    4854             :   a_type_ptr        interface_type;

    4856             : 
    4857             :   check_assertion(curr_token == tok_event &&
    4858             :                   is_immediate_class_type(class_type));
    4859             :   dps->has_event_keyword = TRUE;
    4860             :   (void)get_token();
    4861             :   check_assertion(curr_token == tok_interface);
    4862             :   if (class_specifier(dps, DSI_NO_INPUT_FLAGS, /*vacuous_decl_allowed=*/TRUE,
    4863             :                      /*is_friend_decl=*/FALSE,
    4864             :                      /*marked_as_gnu_extension=*/FALSE, &interface_type,
    4865             :                      &declares_something, &defines_something,
    4866             :                      (a_decl_pos_block *)NULL)) {
    4867             :     if (defines_something) {
    4868             :       /* An event interface cannot be defined in a class. */
    4869             :       pos_error(ec_event_interface_cannot_have_definition,
    4870             :                 &interface_type->source_corresp.decl_position);
    4871             :     } else if (!declares_something) {
    4872             :       expect_error();
    4873             :     } else {
    4874             :       a_class_type_supplement_ptr  ictsp = class_type_supp(interface_type);
    4875             :       if (ictsp->assoc_scope == NULL) {
    4876             :         /* The interface class must have been previously defined. */
    4877             :         pos_error(ec_event_interface_must_be_previously_defined,
    4878             :                   &interface_type->source_corresp.decl_position);
    4879             :       } else {
    4880             :         a_routine_ptr rp;
    4881             :         an_event_interface_ptr eip = alloc_event_interface();

    4920             : 
    4921             : static a_boolean validate_cppcli_enum_base_type(
    4922             :                                               a_type_ptr         *p_base_type,
    4923             :                                               a_source_position  *pos_type)
    4924             : /*
    4925             : *p_base_type was specified as an explicit underlying type for an enum type in
    4926             : C++/CLI mode.  If that type is valid in that context, return TRUE; otherwise,
    4927             : issue an error at the given position and return FALSE.  If *p_base_type is a
    4928             : valid value class type in that context (e.g., System::Boolean), replace
    4929             : *p_base_type by the associated primitive type.  If TRUE is returned, any
    4930             : typerefs are dropped from *p_base_type.

    4933             :   a_boolean   valid = FALSE;

    4941             :     pos_error(ec_enum_base_type_must_be_integral, pos_type);

    4943             :              system_type_from_fundamental_type(base_type) == NULL) {

    4958             : 
    4959         821 : static an_integer_kind scan_explicit_enum_base_type(
    4960             :                                                a_type_ptr         *p_base_type,
    4961             :                                                a_source_position  *pos_type)
    4962             : /*
    4963             : In some modes (e.g., C++11), we accept the explicit specification of an
    4964             : enumeration type's underlying integer type.  For example:
    4965             :         enum E: short int { a, b };
    4966             : If such a base type was specified, the current token is the colon, and this
    4967             : routine scans it along with the specified type.  The integer kind to be used
    4968             : for the underlying type is returned, and *p_base_type is set to the type as
    4969             : scanned if it is valid.  If no base type was specified, ik_none is returned
    4970             : and *p_base_type is left unchanged.
    4971             : */
    4972             : {
    4973         821 :   an_integer_kind  result = (an_integer_kind)ik_none;
    4974             : 
    4975         821 :   if (curr_token == tok_colon && explicit_enum_base_enabled) {
    4976           0 :     a_type_ptr  base_type = NULL;
    4977           0 :     if (report_explicit_enum_base_as_nonstandard) {
    4978           0 :       pos_warning(ec_explicit_enum_base_nonstandard_in_current_mode,
    4979             :                   &pos_curr_token);
    4980             :     }  /* if */
    4981           0 :     (void)get_token();
    4982           0 :     *pos_type = pos_curr_token;
    4983           0 :     add_stop_token(tok_lbrace);
    4984             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4985             :     if (microsoft_mode && disable_access_checking_in_microsoft_enum_bases) {
    4986             :       /* Microsoft compilers accept the following example:
    4987             :            struct S { private: typedef int I; };
    4988             :            enum E: S::I { e };
    4989             :       */
    4990             :       begin_deferral_of_access_checks();
    4991             :     }  /* if */
    4992             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4993           0 :     type_name(&base_type);
    4994             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4995             :     if (microsoft_mode && disable_access_checking_in_microsoft_enum_bases) {
    4996             :       discard_deferred_access_checks();
    4997             :       end_deferral_of_access_checks();
    4998             :     }  /* if */
    4999             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5000           0 :     remove_stop_token(tok_lbrace);
    5001           0 :     if (base_type != NULL) {
    5002           0 :       a_type_ptr  orig_base_type = base_type;
    5003           0 :       if (is_template_dependent_type(base_type)) {
    5004             :         /* Return orig_base_type to be recorded in the IL as the explicit base
    5005             :            type, but proceed with largest_enum_int_kind as the underlying

    5007           0 :         result = largest_enum_int_kind;

    5011             :            handled separately. */
    5012             :         if (!validate_cppcli_enum_base_type(&base_type, pos_type)) {
    5013             :           base_type = NULL;
    5014             :         }  /* if */
    5015             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5016           0 :       } else if (!is_integral_type(base_type)) {
    5017           0 :         pos_error(ec_enum_base_type_must_be_integral, pos_type);
    5018           0 :         base_type = NULL;
    5019             :       } else if (microsoft_mode && microsoft_version < 1800 && !cpp11_mode &&
    5020             :                  is_bool_type(base_type)) {
    5021             :         /* Early Microsoft compilers did not accept bool as the integral type
    5022             :            underlying an enum type (in non-C++/CLI mode). */
    5023             :         pos_error(ec_bool_type_not_allowed, pos_type);
    5024             :         base_type = NULL;
    5025             :       }  /* if */
    5026           0 :       if (base_type != NULL) {
    5027           0 :         *p_base_type = orig_base_type;
    5028           0 :         if (result == (an_integer_kind)ik_none) {
    5029           0 :           result = skip_typerefs(base_type)->variant.integer.int_kind;
    5030             :         }  /* if */
    5031             :       }  /* if */
    5032             :     }  /* if */
    5033             :   }  /* if */
    5034         821 :   return result;
    5035             : }  /* scan_explicit_enum_base_type */
    5036             : 
    5037             : 
    5038        1490 : static void set_enum_representation(a_type_ptr         enum_type,
    5039             :                                     a_source_position  *pos_enum_tag,
    5040             :                                     a_boolean          diag_range,
    5041             :                                     an_integer_kind    explicit_base_kind,
    5042             :                                     a_boolean          min_max_set,
    5043             :                                     a_constant_ptr     min_value,
    5044             :                                     a_constant_ptr     max_value)
    5045             : /*
    5046             : Determine the representation type for the given enumeration type.  When
    5047             : enum_types_can_be_smaller_than_int is FALSE (e.g., in pcc mode and Microsoft
    5048             : modes), it's always "int", and that's already set.  Otherwise, pick the first
    5049             : of "char", "signed char", "unsigned char", "short", "unsigned short", and
    5050             : "int" into which the enumeration values will fit.  Only if
    5051             : enum_types_can_be_larger_than_int (e.g., in strict C++ mode), is there any
    5052             : point in trying "unsigned int" and larger integer types.
    5053             : In some C++ modes, the underlying integer type can be specified explicitly:
    5054             : In that case, explicit_base_kind will indicate the specified integer type.
    5055             : If the range of constants has been determined, min_max_set will be TRUE, and
    5056             : the constants *min_value and *max_value will describe that range.
    5057             : diag_range is FALSE if diagnostics about the representation range are likely
    5058             : unhelpful due to earlier errors (while parsing the enum definition).
    5059             : pos_enum_tag is the position used for diagnostics not related to an explicit
    5060             : base specifier.
    5061             : */
    5062             : {
    5063             : #if CHECKING
    5064        1490 :   if (C_dialect == C_dialect_pcc) {
    5065           0 :     check_assertion(!enum_types_can_be_smaller_than_int &&
    5066             :                     !enum_types_can_be_larger_than_int);
    5067             :   }  /* if */
    5068             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    5069        1490 :   if (explicit_base_kind != (an_integer_kind)ik_none) {
    5070             :     /* An explicit underlying type was specified as part of this enum type
    5071             :        definition (e.g., "enum E: short { e }").  Make sure the type can
    5072             :        represent the range of enumerator constants. */
    5073           0 :     if (min_max_set && !in_range_for_integer_kind(min_value, max_value,
    5074             :                                                   explicit_base_kind)) {
    5075           0 :       pos_ty_error(ec_enum_base_type_too_limited,
    5076           0 :                    &integer_type_supp(enum_type)->base_type_position,
    5077             :                    integer_type(explicit_base_kind));
    5078           0 :       explicit_base_kind = (an_integer_kind)ik_none;
    5079             :     } else {
    5080           0 :       enum_type->variant.integer.int_kind = explicit_base_kind;
    5081             :     }  /* if */
    5082             :   }  /* if */
    5083        1490 :   if (explicit_base_kind != (an_integer_kind)ik_none) {
    5084             :     /* The underlying type is already determined: Nothing to be done. */
    5085        1490 :   } else if (enum_type->variant.integer.is_scoped_enum) {
    5086             :     /* The underlying type for a scoped enum is "int" (unless explicitly
    5087             :        specified). */
    5088        1474 :   } else if (enum_types_can_be_smaller_than_int 
    5089             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5090        1474 :              || (enum_type->variant.integer.packed && gnu_version >= 40000)
    5091        1474 :              || il_header.short_enums
    5092             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5093             :                                                                          ) {
    5094           0 :     if (!min_max_set || in_range_for_integer_kind(min_value, max_value,
    5095             :                                                   plain_char_int_kind)) {
    5096             :       /* "Plain" char. */
    5097           0 :       enum_type->variant.integer.int_kind = plain_char_int_kind;
    5098           0 :     } else if (in_range_for_integer_kind(min_value, max_value,
    5099             :                                          (an_integer_kind)ik_signed_char)) {
    5100             :       /* Signed char. */
    5101           0 :       enum_type->variant.integer.int_kind = (an_integer_kind)ik_signed_char;
    5102           0 :     } else if (in_range_for_integer_kind(min_value, max_value,
    5103             :                                         (an_integer_kind)ik_unsigned_char)) {
    5104             :       /* Unsigned char. */
    5105           0 :       enum_type->variant.integer.int_kind =
    5106             :                                            (an_integer_kind)ik_unsigned_char;
    5107           0 :     } else if (in_range_for_integer_kind(min_value, max_value,
    5108             :                                          (an_integer_kind)ik_short)) {
    5109             :       /* Short. */
    5110           0 :       enum_type->variant.integer.int_kind = (an_integer_kind)ik_short;
    5111           0 :     } else if ((targ_sizeof_short < targ_sizeof_int) &&
    5112           0 :                 in_range_for_integer_kind(min_value, max_value,
    5113             :                                        (an_integer_kind)ik_unsigned_short)) {
    5114             :       /* Unsigned short.  Note that we can only get here if
    5115             :          sizeof(short) < sizeof(int) on the target, for otherwise the
    5116             :          previous test (for "short") is testing the same range as "int"
    5117             :          (into which all enumeration values must fall), so "short" would
    5118             :          have been selected.  This is important, as we would not want
    5119             :          to pick "unsigned short" if the integral promotions would
    5120             :          promote it to "unsigned int" rather than "int". */
    5121           0 :       enum_type->variant.integer.int_kind =
    5122             :                                           (an_integer_kind)ik_unsigned_short;
    5123             :     } else {
    5124             :       /* Use the default representation type, which is already set. */
    5125        1490 :     }  /* if */
    5126             :   }  /* if */
    5127             :   /* If the underlying integer type of enums can be larger than "int" (as
    5128             :      is standard in C++) and if the type has not already been adjusted to
    5129             :      be smaller than int, keep checking. */
    5130        1490 :   if (explicit_base_kind != (an_integer_kind)ik_none) {
    5131             :     /* The underlying type is already determined: Nothing to be done. */
    5132        1490 :   } else if (min_max_set && enum_types_can_be_larger_than_int &&
    5133        1462 :              enum_type->variant.integer.int_kind == (an_integer_kind)ik_int) {
    5134        1462 :     if (in_range_for_integer_kind(min_value, max_value,
    5135             :                                   (an_integer_kind)ik_int)) {
    5136             :       /* Int. */
    5137        1453 :       enum_type->variant.integer.int_kind = (an_integer_kind)ik_int;
    5138           9 :     } else if (in_range_for_integer_kind(min_value, max_value,
    5139             :                                         (an_integer_kind)ik_unsigned_int)) {
    5140             :       /* Unsigned int. */
    5141           9 :       enum_type->variant.integer.int_kind = (an_integer_kind)ik_unsigned_int;
    5142             : 
    5143           0 :     } else if (in_range_for_integer_kind(min_value, max_value,
    5144             :                                          (an_integer_kind)ik_long)) {
    5145             :       /* Long. */
    5146           0 :       enum_type->variant.integer.int_kind = (an_integer_kind)ik_long;
    5147           0 :     } else if (in_range_for_integer_kind(min_value, max_value,
    5148             :                                         (an_integer_kind)ik_unsigned_long)) {
    5149             :       /* Unsigned long. */
    5150           0 :       enum_type->variant.integer.int_kind = (an_integer_kind)ik_unsigned_long;
    5151             : #if LONG_LONG_ALLOWED
    5152           0 :     } else if ((!strict_ansi_mode || long_long_is_standard) &&
    5153           0 :                in_range_for_integer_kind(min_value, max_value,
    5154             :                                          (an_integer_kind)ik_long_long)) {
    5155             :       /* Long long. */
    5156           0 :       enum_type->variant.integer.int_kind = (an_integer_kind)ik_long_long;
    5157           0 :     } else if ((!strict_ansi_mode || long_long_is_standard) &&
    5158           0 :                in_range_for_integer_kind(
    5159             :                                   min_value, max_value,
    5160             :                                   (an_integer_kind)ik_unsigned_long_long)) {
    5161             :       /* Unsigned long long. */
    5162           0 :       enum_type->variant.integer.int_kind =
    5163             :                                      (an_integer_kind)ik_unsigned_long_long;
    5164             : #endif /* LONG_LONG_ALLOWED */
    5165             :     } else {
    5166             :       /* No integer type can hold all the values.  We'll use the largest
    5167             :          available integer type and issue a diagnostic. */
    5168             : #if INT128_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5169             :       /* GNU compilers do not consider 128-bit integer types in this context.
    5170             :          We emulate that behavior. */
    5171             : #endif /* INT128_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5172           0 :       enum_type->variant.integer.int_kind = largest_enum_int_kind;

    5174           0 :         pos_diagnostic(strict_ansi_mode ? es_error : es_warning,
    5175             :                        ec_insufficient_enum_range, pos_enum_tag);
    5176             :       }  /* if */
    5177             :     }  /* if */
    5178             :   }  /* if */

    5180             : 
    5181             : 
    5182         632 : static void check_enum_value_for_fixed_underlying_type(
    5183             :                                              a_constant_ptr   constant,
    5184             :                                              an_integer_kind  underlying_kind,
    5185             :                                              a_boolean        implicit_value,
    5186             :                                              a_boolean        *err)
    5187             : /*
    5188             : Check that an enumerator value fits in the given integer kind (if that kind is
    5189             : ik_none, use ik_int instead).  The enumerator value is the given constant and
    5190             : was specified explicitly if implicit_value is FALSE; otherwise, the enumerator
    5191             : value is obtained implicitly by incrementing the given constant.  If the
    5192             : enumerator value does not fit, an error is issued and *err is set to TRUE.  If
    5193             : no error is issued and implicit_value is TRUE, *constant is incremented.
    5194             : */
    5195             : {
    5196         632 :   a_type_ptr  underlying_type;
    5197             : 
    5198         632 :   if (underlying_kind == (an_integer_kind)ik_none) {
    5199         632 :     underlying_kind = (an_integer_kind)ik_int;
    5200             :   }  /* if */
    5201         632 :   underlying_type = integer_type(underlying_kind);
    5202         632 :   if (implicit_value) {
    5203           0 :     if (is_max_value_for_integer_kind(constant, underlying_kind)) {
    5204             :       /* The implicit increment produces a value that cannot be represented
    5205             :          by the underlying type.  Ordinarily, this is an error, but Microsoft
    5206             :          compilers just wrap the value around. */
    5207           0 :       if (microsoft_mode) {
    5208             :         pos_ty_warning(ec_enum_value_out_of_underlying_range, &error_position,
    5209             :                        underlying_type);
    5210             :         constant->variant.integer_value =
    5211             :                                    min_integer_value_of_kind[underlying_kind];
    5212             :       } else {
    5213           0 :         pos_ty_error(ec_enum_value_out_of_underlying_range, &error_position,
    5214             :                      underlying_type);
    5215           0 :         *err = TRUE;
    5216             :       }  /* if */
    5217             :     } else {
    5218           0 :       incr_integer_value(&constant->variant.integer_value);
    5219             :     }  /* if */
    5220             :   } else {
    5221         632 :     if (!in_range_for_integer_kind(constant, constant, underlying_kind)) {
    5222           0 :       if (microsoft_mode) {
    5223             :         pos_ty_warning(ec_enum_value_out_of_underlying_range, &error_position,
    5224             :                        underlying_type);
    5225             :         /* Truncate the specified value to the length of the underlying type
    5226             :            (taking care to extend the sign bit as needed).  E.g., 1000

    5239           0 :         *err = TRUE;
    5240             :       }  /* if */

    5251             : 
    5252        1490 : static void change_enum_constants_type(a_constant_ptr  constants,
    5253             :                                        a_type_ptr      new_type)
    5254             : /*
    5255             : Change the types of the enumeration constants in the given list to the given

    5285        1490 : void scan_enumerator_list(a_type_ptr             enum_type,
    5286             :                           a_decl_parse_state     *dps,
    5287             :                           a_decl_flag_set        dsi_flags,
    5288             :                           an_ms_attribute_ptr    *p_ms_attributes,
    5289             :                           a_type_ptr             class_of_which_a_member,
    5290             :                           a_boolean              *declares_something,
    5291             :                           a_decl_pos_block       *decl_pos_block)
    5292             : /*
    5293             : Scan the list of enumerators in an enum type definition, including its
    5294             : enclosing braces.  (The current token is the left brace, except perhaps in
    5295             : error cases.)  enum_type is the type whose definition must be scanned.  *dps
    5296             : describes the declaration containing the enum definition (which may include
    5297             : attributes).  dsi_flags is the set of input flags passed to decl_specifiers.
    5298             : p_ms_attributes describes Microsoft COM-style attributes preceding the enum
    5299             : specifier (if any).   class_of_which_a_member specifies the parent type of
    5300             : the enum type.  *declares_something is set to TRUE if an unscoped enum
    5301             : definition introduces a name in its surrounding scope.  *decl_pos_block
    5302             : is updated to reflect relevant positions of this definition.
    5303             : */
    5304             : {
    5305        1490 :   a_symbol_ptr       tag_sym = symbol_for(enum_type), enum_con_sym;
    5306        1490 :   a_boolean          is_scoped_enum =
    5307        1490 :                                     enum_type->variant.integer.is_scoped_enum;
    5308        1490 :   a_boolean          is_dependent_enum = FALSE;
    5309        1490 :   a_boolean          done, min_max_set, diag_range = TRUE;
    5310        1490 :   a_constant_ptr     constant_list = NULL, end_of_enum_con_list, enum_con;
    5311        1490 :   a_constant_ptr     max_value = local_constant();

    5326        1490 :   explicit_base = integer_type_supp(enum_type)->base_type;

    5400        1490 :   if (C_dialect == C_dialect_cplusplus || gcc_mode) {
    5401             :     /* In C++ the type of an enumerator is the same as that of its
    5402             :        enumeration, but that won't actually be known until the definition
    5403             :        is complete.  Set the types in the enum constants later.
    5404             :        In GNU C mode, the type of an enumerator is an integer type
    5405             :        large enough to represent all the enumerator values.  It won't be
    5406             :        known until the definition is complete. */
    5407        1490 :     enum_con_type = NULL;
    5408             :     /* For an enum in a class template the enumerators must be treated as
    5409             :        dependent. */
    5410        1490 :     is_dependent_enum = tag_sym->corresp_nonreal_or_nested_type != NULL;
    5411             :   } else {
    5412             :     /* In C the type of the constants is always "int", regardless of

    5414             :        tagged with the enumerated type, so that enum compatibility checking
    5415             :        can be done later.  (GNU C mode is different: See above.) */
    5416           0 :     check_assertion(!enum_types_can_be_larger_than_int);
    5417           0 :     enum_con_type = alloc_type((a_type_kind)tk_integer);

    5811             :          /* In K&R C, C99, and C++11 modes an extra comma is allowed at the
    5812             :             end of the list.  In other C and C++ modes, we allow it as an
    5813             :             extension, with a remark or strict ANSI diagnostic, but the
    5814             :             diagnostic is omitted altogether for C++11-like scoped enum

    5817             :             part of the SPEC benchmark suite. */

    5964        1491 : void enum_specifier(a_decl_parse_state   *dps,
    5965             :                     a_decl_flag_set      dsi_flags,
    5966             :                     a_boolean            vacuous_decl_allowed,
    5967             :                     a_boolean            is_enum_template_definition,
    5968             :                     a_type_ptr           *type_ptr,
    5969             :                     an_ms_attribute_ptr  *p_ms_attributes,
    5970             :                     a_boolean            *declares_something,
    5971             :                     a_boolean            *defines_something,
    5972             :                     a_decl_pos_block     *decl_pos_block)
    5973             : /*
    5974             : Scan an enumeration specifier (i.e., the definition of an enumeration type) or
    5975             : an elaborated name for an enumeration type (e.g., "enum E").  C++11 scoped
    5976             : enumerations and similar Microsoft extensions are also scanned here.
    5977             : 
    5978             : The type is returned in *type_ptr.  *declares_something is set to indicate
    5979             : whether or not this specifier declares something.  If defines_something is
    5980             : non-NULL, *defines_something is set to indicate whether an enumeration is
    5981             : actually defined.  p_ms_attributes describes Microsoft attributes preceding
    5982             : the enum specifier (if any).  is_enum_template_definition is TRUE if this is
    5983             : called for an out-of-class definition (or opaque declaration) of an enum
    5984             : template.  dsi_flags is the set of input flags passed to decl_specifiers.
    5985             : */
    5986             : {
    5987        1491 :   a_symbol_locator             locator;
    5988        1491 :   a_symbol_ptr                 tag_sym;
    5989        1491 :   a_boolean                    tag_id_present;

    5991        1491 :   a_boolean                    err = FALSE;
    5992        1491 :   a_constant_ptr               max_value = local_constant();
    5993        1491 :   a_constant_ptr               min_value = local_constant();

    6837        8726 : void typename_specifier(a_type_ptr            *type_ptr,
    6838             :                         a_symbol_ptr          *type_sym,
    6839             :                         a_boolean             within_using_decl,
    6840             :                         a_boolean             is_decl_specifier,
    6841             :                         a_decl_pos_block_ptr  decl_pos_block)
    6842             : /*
    6843             : Scan a typename-specifier.  The identifier that follows the typename keyword
    6844             : must be a type name, otherwise a diagnostic is issued.  The type is returned in
    6845             : *type_ptr.  The type symbol is returned in *type_sym.  On return, the current
    6846             : token is the one following the final identifier above.
    6847             : 
    6848             : within_using_decl is TRUE in a class member using declaration that starts with
    6849             : "using typename".  If is_decl_specifier is TRUE, this routine is called from
    6850             : decl_specifiers; in that case, this routine may return NULL in some Microsoft
    6851             : modes if the tokens following the keyword "typename" do not actually start a
    6852             : type name.  decl_pos_block is a possibly NULL pointer to a block of source
    6853             : position information when the context is a declaration.

    6935           0 : static void cache_std_attribute_group(a_token_cache  *cache)

    6956        4219 : static a_symbol_ptr look_up_class_member_decl(a_type_ptr          class_type,
    6957             :                                               a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
    6958             : /*
    6959             : Look up the current identifier in the given class and return the symbol found.
    6960             : *dps describes the declaration for which this look-up is done: If its declared
    6961             : storage class is "static", consider the C++/CLI static constructor (which is
    6962             : unique); otherwise consider for the ordinary constructor (which might be an
    6963             : overload set).
    6964             : */
    6965             : {
    6966        4219 :   an_id_lookup_options_set  idl_options = IDL_DIRECT_CLASS_MEMBERS_ONLY;

    6979             : 
    6980       24212 : a_boolean is_constructor_decl(a_type_ptr          class_type,

    7288             : 
    7289             : /*
    7290             : Macro that determines whether the current mode allows certain typedefs to be
    7291             : modified by sign and/or size specifiers.  E.g.:
    7292             :   typedef long L;  unsigned L x;  // Allowed in some modes.
    7293             : */
    7294             : #define current_mode_allows_typedef_with_adjectives()                       \
    7295             :   (C_dialect == C_dialect_pcc || gpp_mode || (gcc_mode && gnu_version < 30400))
    7296             : 
    7297           0 : static a_basic_type basic_type_from_typedef(a_decl_parse_state  *dps,
    7298             :                                             a_type_sign         *sign,
    7299             :                                             a_type_size         *size)
    7300             : /*
    7301             : dps->specifiers_type represents a typedef used as a specifier in the current
    7302             : declaration-like construct (described by dps).  Some modes allow certain
    7303             : typedef types to be modified by sign and size specifiers (short, unsigned,
    7304             : etc.).  If dps->specifiers_type is such a typedef, return the associated basic
    7305             : type specifier and set *sign and *size to the sign and size of the type
    7306             : underlying that typedef.  Also set dps->specifiers_type to NULL in that case.
    7307             : Otherwise, return bt_typedef and leave dps->specifiers_type, *sign, and *size
    7308             : unchanged.
    7309             : */
    7310             : {
    7311           0 :   a_basic_type     basic_type = bt_typedef;
    7312           0 :   a_type_ptr       temp_type = skip_typerefs(dps->specifiers_type);
    7313           0 :   an_integer_kind  ikind;
    7314           0 :   a_float_kind     fkind;
    7315             : 
    7316           0 :   if (temp_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_integer) {
    7317           0 :     if (temp_type->variant.integer.enum_type ||
    7318             :         temp_type->variant.integer.bool_type) {
    7319             :       /* Don't allow adjectives on enum integers or bool. */
    7320             :     } else {
    7321             :       /* Adjectives (size and sign) are only allowed where they
    7322             :          fill in empty holes -- unspecified attributes -- in the
    7323             :          following table:
    7324             : 
    7325             :                                     sign      size      base type
    7326             :            ik_signed_char                    -fixed-     char
    7327             :            ik_unsigned_char       see note   -fixed-     char
    7328             :            ik_short                          short       int
    7329             :            ik_unsigned_short      unsigned   short       int
    7330             :            ik_int                                        int
    7331             :            ik_unsigned_int        unsigned               int
    7332             :            ik_long                           long        int
    7333             :            ik_unsigned_long       unsigned   long        int
    7334             :            ik_long_long                      long long   int
    7335             :            ik_unsigned_long_long  unsigned   long long   int
    7336             : 
    7337             :          In pcc mode, the "signed" keyword does not exist, so something
    7338             :          that is signed really has unspecified sign.  Note that ik_char
    7339             :          is not used in pcc mode, so ik_unsigned_char has to be viewed
    7340             :          as not specifying a sign if it is plain_char_int_kind.
    7341             :          ik_signed_char always implies an unspecified sign.  A size may
    7342             :          not be specified for those ("short char" and "long char" don't
    7343             :          make sense). */
    7344           0 :       check_assertion(*sign != sign_none || *size != size_none);
    7345           0 :       ikind = temp_type->variant.integer.int_kind;
    7346           0 :       switch (ikind) {
    7347             :         case ik_char:
    7348             :           basic_type = bt_char;
    7349             :           break;
    7350           0 :         case ik_unsigned_char:
    7351           0 :           if (plain_char_int_kind != ikind && *sign != sign_none) break;
    7352             :           /* Fall into signed char case. */
    7353             :           /*FALLTHROUGH*/
    7354             :         case ik_signed_char:
    7355           0 :           if (*size != size_none
    7356             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7357             :               && *size != size_int8
    7358             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7359             :                                   ) break;
    7360             :           basic_type = bt_char;
    7361             :           break;
    7362           0 :         case ik_short:
    7363             :           /* GNU C++ allows many strange things for a type specifier in a new
    7364             :              expression (e.g., "long" on a typedef for "short").  We only
    7365             :              emulate cases that are unlikely to be surprising (i.e., extraneous
    7366             :              modifiers). */
    7367           0 :           if (*size == size_none ||
    7368           0 :               (gpp_mode && dps->is_new_expr_type && *size == size_short)) {
    7369           0 :             basic_type = bt_int;
    7370           0 :             *size = size_short;
    7371             :           }  /* if */
    7372             :           break;
    7373           0 :         case ik_unsigned_short:
    7374             :           /* No holes to fill in. */
    7375             :           /* GNU C++ allows many strange things for a type specifier in a new
    7376             :              expression (e.g., "long" on a typedef for "short").  We only
    7377             :              emulate cases that are unlikely to be surprising (i.e., extraneous
    7378             :              modifiers). */
    7379           0 :           if (gpp_mode && dps->is_new_expr_type &&
    7380           0 :               ((*size == size_short && *sign == sign_unsigned) ||
    7381           0 :                (*size == size_none && *sign == sign_unsigned) ||
    7382           0 :                (*size == size_short && *sign == sign_none))) {
    7383           0 :             basic_type = bt_int;
    7384           0 :             *sign = sign_unsigned;

    7386             :           }  /* if */
    7387             :           break;
    7388           0 :         case ik_unsigned_int:
    7389             :           /* GNU C++ allows many strange things for a type specifier in a new
    7390             :              expression (e.g., "signed" on a typedef for "unsigned").  We only

    7821           0 : static a_type_ptr make_c11_atomic_type(a_type_ptr         utp,
    7822             :                                        a_source_position  *diag_pos,
    7823             :                                        a_boolean          prev_quals_allowed)
    7824             : /*
    7825             : Make and return a C11 _Atomic type based on the given underlying type.  Return
    7826             : an error type if utp is null, an error type, an array type, or a function type;

    8052           0 : static a_boolean implicit_int_member_with_name_of_type(void)
    8053             : /*
    8054             : Helper called from decl_specifiers to determine if the current identifier
    8055             : might have meant to be a declarator in Cfront or Microsoft mode.  Both those
    8056             : modes accept:
    8057             :    struct X; struct Y { X(); };
    8058             : and take Y::X to be an ordinary member function returning int.
    8059             : Note that Microsoft will not accept such function declarations if they take
    8060             : any parameters.  Cfront will, but that behavior is not imitated here.
    8061             : Recent Microsoft compilers (microsoft_version >= 1310) still accept the code
    8062             : above, but reject the code if X is neither a class type nor an enum type.
    8063             : */

    8076             :       result = (is_class_struct_union_type(type) ||
    8077             :                 is_enum_type(type));

    8086         862 : static a_boolean looks_like_member_function_declarator(void)
    8087             : /*
    8088             : We are scanning the specifiers for a class template member.  The current token
    8089             : is an identifier assumed to refer to a type because of the presence of a
    8090             : template-dependent base class.  However, it might be that the identifier was
    8091             : meant to be a member function name declared with the "implicit int return"
    8092             : assumption.  For example:
    8093             :     template<typename T> struct B {}
    8094             :     template<typename T> struct D: B<T> { f(); };
    8095             : Return TRUE if this looks like it is the case (and the code could not
    8096             : otherwise be valid).
    8097             : Recognizing such cases allows for a closer (but not exact) emulation of the
    8098             : behavior of Microsoft compilers, and also enables better error recovery in
    8099             : other modes.
    8100             : */
    8101             : {
    8102         862 :   a_boolean      result = FALSE;
    8103         862 :   a_token_cache  cache;
    8104             :

    8106             :   /* Cache the identifier. */
    8107         862 :   check_assertion(curr_token == tok_identifier && !C_mode());
    8108         862 :   cache_curr_token(&cache);
    8109         862 :   (void)get_token();
    8110         862 :   if (curr_token == tok_lparen) {
    8111           0 :     cache_curr_token(&cache);
    8112           0 :     (void)get_token();
    8113           0 :     if (!is_declarator_start() && !is_ptr_to_member_declarator_start()) {
    8114             :       /* We're not dealing with a construct of the form
    8115             :              T (<nested-declarator>) ...
    8116             :          So this must be a member function declarator for a declaration that
    8117             :          assumes "implicit int return" rules. */
    8118             :       result = TRUE;
    8119             :     }  /* if */
    8120             :   }  /* if */
    8121             :   /* Restore the token state. */
    8122         862 :   rescan_cached_tokens(&cache);
    8123         862 :   return result;

    8126             : 
    8127             : /* Define a bit vector to be used within decl_specifiers to track which
    8128             :    specifiers have been encountered. */

    8130             : #define DS_NONE (a_decl_specifiers_set)(0x0)
    8131             :                         /* No decl-specifiers have been scanned. */
    8132             : #define DS_STORAGE_CLASS (a_decl_specifiers_set)(0x1)
    8133             :                         /* A storage class has been scanned (this doesn't

    8135             :                            which are storage-class-specifiers, but have no

    8139             :                            Microsoft type qualifiers "near" and "far") has
    8140             :                            been scanned. */

    8142             :                         /* A basic type or a size or "signed" or "unsigned"
    8143             :                            has been scanned. */

    8163             :                         /* "void" was scanned as the very first specifier. */

    8242             : #if UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    8243             : 
    8244             : static void scan_upc_block_size_if_any(a_decl_parse_state    *state,
    8245             :                                        a_basic_type          basic_type,
    8246             :                                        a_decl_pos_block_ptr  decl_pos_block,
    8247             :                                        a_boolean             *err)
    8248             : /*
    8249             : Scan the constant integer block size specified on a UPC shared type qualifier.
    8250             : This routine also scans the enclosing brackets.  E.g.,
    8251             :         shared[100] int a[35];  // Block size 100
    8252             : If a block size was actually specified, the fact is recorded in *state.
    8253             : The current token must be "shared."  decl_pos_block is updated with the
    8254             : final position of the construct (whether or not a block size was specified).
    8255             : */
    8256             : {
    8257             :   /* If not otherwise specified, the block size will be 1. */
    8258             :   a_upc_block_size  block_size = 1;
    8259             : 
    8260             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    8261             :   if (decl_pos_block != NULL) {
    8262             :     /* If no block size followed, the specifier's end is the last position
    8263             :        of the "shared" token. */

    8265             :   }  /* if */

    8267             :   /* Skip the "shared" token. */
    8268             :   check_assertion(curr_token == (a_token_kind)tok_upc_shared);
    8269             :   (void)get_token();

    8271             :     /* A shared block specifier. */

    8525     6831120 : static a_boolean process_nontype_identifier(
    8526             :                                 a_decl_parse_state        *dps,
    8527             :                                 a_decl_specifiers_set     decl_specifiers_seen,
    8528             :                                 a_decl_flag_set           input_flags,
    8529             :                                 a_basic_type              *basic_type,
    8530             :                                 a_named_address_space_id  *named_address_space,
    8531             :                                 a_boolean                 *err)
    8532             : /*
    8533             : The current token is an identifier or (in C++) a global qualification token
    8534             : ("::") followed by an identifier.  If the name introduced by this token is
    8535             : a type name, it is normally part of the decl-specifier and handled by the
    8536             : caller.  If the name is not a type name, the work is mostly done in this
    8537             : routine or in declarator processing.  This includes named memory regions (part
    8538             : of the specifiers; an Embedded C/TR 18037 extension) and constructors (part of
    8539             : the declarator).
    8540             : dps describes the declaration being parsed.  decl_specifiers_seen records some
    8541             : of the specifiers (virtual, inline, ...) that may have been seen already.
    8542             : input_flags is the flag set passed to decl_specifiers.  *basic_type represents
    8543             : the basic type specifier that was seen (if any) and may be set to bt_no_type
    8544             : if this is a constructor (or in C++/CLI, a static constructor).  If the current
    8545             : token names an address space, *named_address_space is set to represent it;
    8546             : otherwise it is set to zero.  Unusual syntax errors (e.g., "::" followed by
    8547             : something unexpected) cause *err to be set to TRUE.
    8548             : If the identifier is not part of the decl-specifiers (i.e., either part
    8549             : of a declarator or a syntax error) return TRUE; otherwise return FALSE.
    8550             : */
    8551             : {
    8552     6831120 :   a_boolean  result = FALSE;
    8553     6831120 :   a_boolean  identifier_names_address_space = FALSE;

    8674             :   }  /* if */

    8691           0 : static void check_use_of_thread_local(a_decl_parse_state  *dps)
    8692             : /*
    8693             : Callback routine called at the end of processing for a declaration containing
    8694             : the thread_local/_Thread_local specifier.  Issue an error if the specifier is

    8696             : otherwise.

    8699           0 :   a_symbol_ptr  sym = dps->sym;
    8700             : 
    8701           0 :   if ((dps->dso_flags & DSO_THREAD_LOCAL) == 0) {
    8702             :     /* Nothing to do.  This can occur if previous diagnostics "canceled" the
    8703             :        thread_local specifier. */

    8715             :              can only appear as members.  Ignore it (an error has already been

    8812             : 
    8813      111827 : static void process_storage_class_specifier(
    8814             :                                   a_token_kind           first_token,
    8815             :                                   a_decl_flag_set        input_flags,
    8816             :                                   a_decl_parse_state     *state,
    8817             :                                   a_decl_pos_block_ptr   decl_pos_block,
    8818             :                                   a_boolean              first_specifier,
    8819             :                                   a_decl_specifiers_set  *decl_specifiers_seen,
    8820             :                                   a_boolean              *err)
    8821             : /*
    8822             : This is a helper function for decl_specifiers(...) called when the first_token
    8823             : is the first token of a storage class specifier (or "mutable", which is
    8824             : syntactically similar).  (first_token is usually also the only token of the
    8825             : storage class specifier; the only exception are named-register storage class
    8826             : specifiers.)  input_flags, state, and decl_pos_block are parameters forwarded
    8827             : from decl_specifiers.  If first_specifier is TRUE, the storage specifier token
    8828             : was the first decl-specifier (ignoring "friend", "inline", and
    8829             : "thread_local/_Thread_local"); a warning may be issued if that is not the
    8830             : case.  *decl_specifiers_seen is updated with an indication of the specifiers
    8831             : that were consumed.  *err is set to TRUE if an error is issued.  All the
    8832             : storage class specifier tokens are consumed by this routine, except for "auto"
    8833             : which is processed after any other specifiers have also been consumed.
    8834             : */
    8835             : {
    8836      111827 :   a_boolean          is_parameter = (input_flags & DSI_IS_PARAMETER) != 0;
    8837      111827 :   a_boolean          is_member_decl =
    8838      111827 :                                (input_flags & DSI_IS_MEMBER_DECLARATION) != 0;
    8839      111827 :   a_boolean          is_named_register = FALSE;
    8840      111827 :   a_source_position  pos_first_token;
    8841             : 
    8842             :   /* For "auto" as a storage class specifier, this routine is called after
    8843             :      all specifiers have been scanned already.  For all other cases, the
    8844             :      specifier token is the current token. */
    8845      111827 :   if (first_token != tok_auto) {
    8846      111827 :     check_assertion(curr_token == first_token);
    8847      111827 :     pos_first_token = pos_curr_token;
    8848      111827 :     (void)get_token();
    8849             :   } else {
    8850           0 :     pos_first_token = state->auto_pos;
    8851             :   }  /* if */

    8853           0 :     pos_warning(ec_secondary_specifier_ignored, &pos_first_token);
    8854           0 :     goto done;
    8855             :   }  /* if */
    8856             : #if NAMED_REGISTERS_ALLOWED

    9062          78 :         pos_diagnostic(strict_ansi_mode ? es_warning : es_remark,
